name_left: Mini “Castle” at Magical Malibu Ranch
description:
An Eleven Acre Ranch - just 1/2 Mile to the Ocean / PCH

The 'Castle' is a unique, rustic two level stone apartment. Upstairs is equipped with a fridge, stove top, sink & cozy living room. Through a trap door, down concrete stairs, find the cave-like bedroom and bathroom.

Explore scenic trails on our property. We welcome you to pop a cork & breath it all in.

We also offer the 'Magical Malibu Ranch' on Airbnb.
It is a 2 Bedroom ranch style home located on the same property - check it out :)

The space
You will SHARE the 11 acres with 19 chickens and occasionally guests from our "Magical Malibu Ranch House".
A seasonal creek flows through the property around huge oaks & eucalyptus trees. The stone home keeps you cool as you have the best sleep of your life in a cave like chamber.
Stroll up the hill on your own personal scenic trail, to our unobstructed Ocean View picnic area. Write, play music, surf, beach, hik
neighborhood_overview:
Malibu, for us, is trails, hiking and riding. For others, it is surfing, beaches and shopping.

We are situated right in the middle of everything Malibu has to offer. No long winding drives - unless you want to :)

From the 'Castle', the beach is 1/2 mile drive or a 15-min walk to Latigo shores. World renown '1st point' Malibu pier beach is a 10-minute drive and Zuma beach is a 15-minute drive.

We are between Solstice Canyon and Escondido Canyon Parks.
Many others are only a short drive away.

Latigo Canyon Road is also a famous motorcycle, road bike and driving canyon road. Be safe!
host_about: I grew up in NYC ...found my way to the beach and fell in love with the ocean and the mountains.  Ive been here ever since.

description:

Fall asleep listening to the sound of crashing waves. Perfectly situated in Malibu without being too far from LA: 4 minutes from Malibu Pier& only 15 minutes from Santa Monica Pier. host_about:
Hi, my name is Stuart and I'm a born and raised New Yorker living in Los Angeles with my family. Serial entrepreneur and owner of LA's most trusted and popular short-term rental company, Stay Awhile Villas.    I have traveled the world and love passing along my best travel experiences to our guests by making you feel like a member of an expensive travel club.   We have a beautiful collection of luxury residences including some of our own in the most popular neighborhoods in Los Angeles, Beverly Hills, Pacific Palisades, Bel Air, Hollywood Hills, and of course Malibu.  We are extremely accomplished hosts on Airbnb with the following accolades:

   -  9 x Airbnb Superhost, 10 Airbnb Plus Listings.
   -  10 LUX Listings
    - 779+ 5-Star reviews

Our properties have been featured in Travel + Leisure, Angeleno, People Magazine, FOX, NBC, Wall Street Journal, Daily Mail, TMZ, History Channel, Mansion Global, Los Angeles Times, New York Times, and more.  Our guests include some of the most famous film and music personalities, C level executives of Fortune 500 companies, and Royal Families. 

Whether you are coming here for vacation, business, or pleasure we are here to make your stay as simple and luxurious as possible.  We offer the following services to our guests via our concierge partner(*additional fees may apply):

    - Personal Chefs and Catering
    - Luxury Dining Recommendations and Reservations
    - Vacation Planning and Excursion Recommendations 
    - Villa Pre-Stocking (Groceries and Personal Item Requests) 
    - Luxury Vehicle Rentals 
    - Chauffeur Services
    - Yacht/Jet Charters 
   

See all our Airbnb portfolio of listings here: www.airbnb.com/p/los-angeles-vacation-rentals   I would also recommend you read our incredible reviews - https://www.airbnb.com/users/reviews/ (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Thank you for taking the time to read a little about us and we look forward to working with you. 

Stuart Heller and the Stay Awhile Team

name_left: Pacific Palisades Home with Stunning Views
description:
Beautiful fully-furnished up in the hills. Stunning views of the ocean, mountains and city. Located in a charming, coastal neighborhood called Pacific Palisades. A peaceful and quiet setting where nature is at your back door. Enjoy fruit trees and occasional deer and rabbits grazing in the yard.

Away from the hustle and bustle but only minutes to the “village" (markets, cafes, restaurants, farmers market, parks, hiking trails and more) along with surrounding cities; SM, Venice, Malibu etc.

The space
Open, airy, warm, quiet and inviting. Great areas to sit and relax while looking out over the ocean, Santa Monica mountains and city. Dine in or out under the stars and enjoy the sparkling city lights at night.

Guest access
Local hiking trails (trail head with in walking distance), quiet suburban neighborhood.

Other things to note
Bedroom 2 (Red room) has a full and twin bed at all times. There is a crib
neighborhood_overview:
Pacific Palisades lies North of Santa Monica and South of Malibu, with the Pacific Ocean and Will Rogers State Beach on its southern boundary. The Western boundary is located in the Castellammare area at the J. Paul Getty Museum. The Northeast boundary is at the periphery of the Riviera Country Club. The Northern boundaries are provided by the picturesque and rugged Santa Monica mountains.

It is primarily a residential area, with a mixture of large private homes, small (usually older) houses, condominiums, and apartments. Every Fourth of July, the community's Chamber of Commerce sponsors day-long events which include 5K and 10K runs, a parade down Sunset Boulevard, and a fireworks display at Palisades High School football field. The district also includes some large parklands and many hiking trails.
host_about:
We are fellow Airbnb hosts and guests.  We are hosts to a couple of homes one in Pacific Palisades and Santa Monica.  This Airbnb account is enjoyed by Beth Galanty,  her brother Mark Galanty as well as,  sister-in-law  Caroline Galanty.

Beth and Mark,  sister and brother  grew up in Pacific Palisades since 1966.  Pacific Palisades is a very special place to grow and and visit.  They both love to explore and live in and around the City of Los Angeles - there is so much to offer.

Both families have 3 young adults and all  love to travel.

Mark is an active hiker, Skier, White Water Rafter, motorcycle rider, and camper.
Beth loves to explore and get lost with out a map.  Loves to hike, go to art exhibits, movies, enjoys the gorgeous beaches and looks for hidden treasures on the road or in various cities.  She is a foodie and loves to find whole in the walls as well as the trendy.  She takes advantage of other wonderful Airbnb'ers on her travels.

We hope to share this house with people who appreciate beauty, sights, sounds of nature, and the quaintness of the Palisades village.  Pacific Palisades is a unique place - a special hide-a-way within a big city.  It is a great location nestled between Santa Monica and Malibu.  Close to UCLA, Westwood, both, Getty museums, Will Roger's house with tons of great  hiking close by (Santa Monica mountains) and the most beautiful beaches in the world for lounging, walking, surfing etc.

And don't forget LA has some of the best restaurants!  We are happy to make recommendations.

You know you will love your stay and we are here to help!

neighborhood_overview:
Pacific Palisades is located between Santa Monica and Malibu.

The Pacific Palisades Highlands is a peaceful, beautiful area among the Santa Monica Mountains with easy access to great hiking and mountain biking trails. A great Italian restaurant called Casa Nostra is a short walk from our home.

Two miles down the hill is the Palisades Highlands Village center with a Starbucks, nail salon, fitness studio and three more restaurants (Chez Mimi, Taste and Moku Sushi).

The village of Pacific Palisades is small, upscale and friendly, with boutique shops, restaurants, Starbucks, grocery stores, a beach, and beautiful bluffs overlooking the ocean. There is a popular open air farmer’s market on Sundays.

5 of 5 stars Reviewed April 14, 2015 Michelle New York
What a pleasant stay we had at this home! We were traveling with 3 pre-teens , 2 parents and a grandparent and we all really enjoyed our stay. This rental is just above the beach in Pacific Palisades.. So the location is perfect for sitting on the beach, going to the Santa Monica Pier or heading up the coast to see the beautiful coastline. We traveled all over LA during this visit and we found this location to be a convenient base for exploring everywhere.
The backyard of this home is a beautiful tropical oasis with a lovely pool, large outdoor dining area and BBQ/ bar area. There are plenty of lounge chairs around the pool. What a relaxing way to spend the day after a busy day of sightseeing among all the crowds of LA!
neighborhood_overview:
This is an ideal location, 1 minute to the beach by car, 10 minutes to Malibu, 10 minutes to Santa Monica, 15 minutes to Venice Beach, 25 minutes to Beverly Hills, 25 minutes to Hollywood.

We are 1 minute from Temescal Canyon Recreational Park and the hiking trails in the Santa Monica mountains with stunning views overlooking the Pacific Ocean and the city. The chic Pacific Palisades Village is less than 2 miles away for shopping and restaurants and an organic farmers market on Sunday mornings.

In the other direction we are 1 minute to the splendor and beauty of the infamous Lake Shrine Meditation Center and it’s scenic lake and gardens. A walk around the grounds is an uniquely spiritual and tranquil experience.

A 1 mile drive will take you to Temescal Canyon parking for the start of the Pacific Ocean boardwalk which runs all the way from Pacific Palisades to Santa Monica Pier, Venice Beach and Marina Del Rey where the beautiful yachts are moored.

Hi!  

I'm Jane, your host!  I'm also mom (to Piper), girlfriend (to Brian), west coast director (for NY Magazine), and a sometime interior designer (mostly for friends).

I love my family and my work, traveling (especially when it involves great hotels!), and hitting a good yoga or spin class (I'm kinda lying about the last thing). I was once left at a gas station on a family camping trip to the Grand Canyon.  I love music of all kinds...and my iPod playlist has everything from Ryan (URL HIDDEN) The (URL HIDDEN) Eminem.

When I made the decision to start hosting I had no idea what to expect.  I had no idea that the human rewards (aka friendships) would far outweigh any monetary rewards.  So thank you Airbnb...I totally LOVE being a part of this awesome global community!

description:
My cozy little house is surrounded by a Topanga paradise providing a relaxing getaway w/ full amenities. The perfect little Topanga Hideaway. Your own private yoga area and waterfall. Parking included, short & long term available.

The space
Please read before booking :)

I would like to start off by mentioning that I have marked this listing as being able to accommodate four guests, based on the idea of two couples coming and sharing the space and one of them being willing to sleep in a full size bed, which for many could be way to small. While this space can accommodate four people it is still a 2 bedroom home , and while perfect for 2 guests, and a child, 4 adults can be to close of quarters for some. I can provide an air mattress or floor mattress and for the brave there are hammocks outside in the oak trees.

My constantly evolving property is one of the ways I enjoy expressing my creativity. I have a passion for nature and gardening a
host_about:
“ Only from the heart can you touch the sky” ~RUMI

Greetings! My name is Alexander, and if fate has it, I hope to be able to share a taste of why people travel from all over the world to Los Angeles, and choose Topanga Canyon as their place to land.   

keep it simple … and above all... keep it real. 

I love supporting causes I believe in and living life to its fullest.  I believe every moment an opportunity to seize our destiny and happiness.  If I had to choose a religion... it would be love. 

Im passionate about finding new and fun creative ways of generating abundance while making a positive difference.  

I’d consider myself an entrepreneur and most of my financial success has been  in Festival/Event Production, Classic Car Restoration and Sales, Management of Cannabis stores and brands and ofcourse landscape design and horticulture which hopefully you will get a chance to see if you come and visit my little slice of heaven. 

I spend most of my free time writing music/poetry, traveling,  gardening and  hunting for treasures.   

I hold integrity, love, compassion and being of service to others as key values that I strive to apply to every moment and situation.

I am grateful for everything that this life and my creator has blessed me with, including the honor of being the guardian of this sacred and special property. It has a way of calling in magical kin and like hearted beings who are seeking respite and a place to let the creative juices flow! 

My favorite place's to travel to are Bali,, Costa Rica, Tulum, Corsica, Hana/Kauai  and France.

I am a writer, an artist, and a creative expressionist of many forms.

Once upon a Time 
Within a rhyme, 
There rested a place, 
A Space and Time,
Where in a space of Void
All Is To Be…
The Expression that is You…
And the Expression that is Me…

In the Emptiness and Void,
In its Darkness and Whole…
We gave birth to a Light 
That has now lost control.
Shifting and growing 
and glowing so bright,
spark of Infinity 
in the Infinite Night.

Growing and Glowing,
Expanding with Knowing
Breathing and Living
Moving and Flowing,
Silent and Still,
Eternal and Whole,
Infinitely Empty, and Eternally Full.

As you Grow in your Light, in this Infinite Night,
Shining so radiantly White and so Bright,
Your Mother, the Darkness, the Earth and her Womb, 
Has Offered her Emptiness as your Life and your Tomb,
The Gift of this Life and the Gift of our Death.
The Contraction and Expansion of Breath.

And in the Gift of Challenge,
Times I thought to much to bear,
I discovered there was a Gift, 
that which I would like to Share,
For it is the gift of becoming strong 
And cultivating Gifts for you to Give,
Empowering you to heal others,
As you are Blessed in how you Live.

Grounded in your Presence,
Connected and Divinely Aware.
Of the stories that we Create,
Within the Stories that we Bear…
Guided by our Hearts,
Our Minds become the Tool,
to Uncover and Discover 
Limitless Jewels...
Within and all around Us.

May you always remember to live without fear.
For our physical Death will always be near.
May this be the Gift that allows you to see...
The Present of the Moment, that is You, and is Me.
And in the Presence of this Moment, 
Please know I took the Time, 
to share with you this rhyme, 
because I Love You…

It is Fear that Separates us and makes Life hard to live,
You must always remember to Love and to Give, 
to forgive and to love, for there’s so much Love… 
and this is why, the reason at hand, 
that I share with You this Gift that's so grand.
To do what you Love, To Be True to You,
To do things that honor You,
In all that You Do!

To give is to Live 
is to Love 
is to Be….
So abundantly full and yet so empty and free…
To love… 
this is to live… 
and so I love you.

The Wish I Wish to Give You is the Gift of Love for You….
Please forgive me…I forgive you . Thank You....I love you. 

~AMW

neighborhood_overview:
The Palisades is one of the safest, most family oriented upscale neighborhood in Los Angeles. It has a village with restaurants, markets, banks, public olympic size pool, a park where you can reserve and play tennis, etc.


We are humble, but still appreciate a Los Angeles phrase:
" If you are lucky you live in Pacific Palisades". We do feel very lucky.

Plenty of restaurants by the beach, Will Rogers park nearby , where polo is played, many hicking trails , and of course the beach.

Everyone is casual and low key, many celebrities live around here, but no one stops them for autographs, nor do we have the tourist buses running around.
host_about:
Hi 

Our family loves to travel, we have a beautiful home on the California coast,
Pacific Palisades, it is between Santa Monica and Malibu.

We have done many home exchanges and experienced staying at a home rather than a hotel, so we have now decided to start hosting via airbnb.

Our home and its surroundings are very much like the Mediterranean coast, plus all the excting places this area has to offer.  You will enjoy the ocean views, swimming pool, while you take a brake from your activities.

I live with my son


  We have a peaceful and healthy life style.   

We look forward to meet you and make your stay a wonderful experience.

If you are into wine, Malibu Vineyards is a beautiful w
neighborhood_overview: Pacific Palisades is a charming, affluent beachside community in the Westside of the city of Los Angeles, located in the center of Brentwood to the east, Malibu and Topanga to the west, Santa Monica to the southeast, the Santa Monica Bay to the southwest, and the Santa Monica Mountains to the north. The area currently is home to about 27,000 residents. It is primarily a residential area, with a mixture of large private homes, small (usually older) houses, condominiums, and apartments. Every Fourth of July, the community's Chamber of Commerce sponsors day-long events which include 5K and 10K runs, a parade down Sunset Boulevard, and a fireworks display at Palisades High School football field. The district also includes several large parklands and many hiking trails. The Village is the Pacific Palisades' walkable, vibrant small central business district with its center at Sunset Boulevard and Via de la Paz. The Village consists of a weekly farmers' market, restaurants, cafés, and coffee
host_about: I am an entertainment industry executive, a psychotherapist, a Mom, a philanthropist and an L.A. native. An extensive traveler, I have always preferred charming bed and breakfast-style lodging over big, impersonal hotels. I appreciate all of the special touches that great hosts provide, and I strive to do the same for my guests. My home is your home! I will do my very best make your stay in Los Angeles as comfortable and memorable as I can!

Whether you're in the fast lane or just cruising, I'll host you here at the cottage for the stay of a lifetime. ;)

https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/35064956?s=67&shared_item_type=1&virality_entry_point=1&sharer_id=108021251

The space
The Main House on the bluffs in Pacific Palisades was built by my father in the 1940s. This Williamsburg Colonial Style House was one of the first houses along this stretch of the California coast.

After my father passed we converted the 850 sq foot garage into a cozy little two story cottage that has the same look and feel as the main house. Because we are at the beach (as stated in the Amenities section) there is no central heat
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is picturesque. I've known most of the neighbors in this area for over 40 years. Friendly, inviting, very laid back... the town of Pacific Palisades reminds me of the beach version of Mayberry. And if you happen to be traveling over the 4th of July, the parade through Pacific Palisades (loaded with music, drinks and celebrities) is a once in a lifetime experience.

As of September, 2018, The Caruso development is now open with fine dining, shopping and a new Cinepolis Movie Theater all within a brisk 10 minute walk.
host_about:
I was born and raised right here at the beach in Pacific Palisades and grew up in this Williamsburg Colonial style home my father built in the 1940's. My parents both had the gift of hospitality and without a doubt it's been passed on to me. I LOVE to entertain and when my friends from all over the world come to LA, I'm the designated master of ceremonies.

From Disneyland to Venice Beach to College Pubs to The Magic Castle, I have always been the straw that stirs the drinks when it comes to experiencing this town from the inside out.

I was a child actor in the 70's, played in bands as a singer/songwriter, I'm a writer and filmmaker now and I believe that very little in this life is more valuable than the memories we make when we encounter and connect with other people. 

I'm fascinated by great stories. It's food for my soul. I can't wait to hear yours!

host_about:
Hi and thanks for taking a look.

Excited to be on AirBnB renting a few properties. These are in great locations close to LA , Orange County, and the Sierras for vacations any time of year!

We are experienced landlords and property managers with over 10 rentals spanning the last 15 years. With decades of home ownership experience, so we understand what a good property needs (and doesn't need) to help ensure a great stay without breaking the bank.

We are also avid travelers so have stocked the kitchen with supplies, the bathrooms with toiletries, and the garage with recreational equipment to ensure memorable experiences.

Feel free to reach out with questions on the area, best sightseeing and seasons, tips on other rentals etc.

name_left: Romantic Ocean View House with Five-Minute Walk to Beach
description:
Elegantly casual, fully-appointed hillside ocean view home on edge of Pacific Palisades, 10 minutes to Santa Monica and Malibu. Fall asleep to the sea, wake up to Catalina views. Robes and slippers await as you sip coffee on the deck or enjoy the ocean view shower or tub. Relax into the sights and subtle sounds of the sea. Exposed beam ceilings, wood-burning fireplace, teak floors, and high-end finishes make for a restorative retreat. Private chef & masseuse available. Come to Casa Castellammare!

License number
HSR19-002853
neighborhood_overview:
* 5-minute walk along our quiet street from front door to toes in sand...10-minute walk back due to a subtle, but steady incline.
* Exploring the 'Secret Stairs' in the neighborhood past storied and historic residences, and, of course, bucolic ocean vistas
* Hiking Los Liones trail, the trail head only a 15-20 minute walk from house.
* Self-Realization Center, a 20-minute walk from the house...enjoy a short stroll around the small lake, all are welcome. :)
host_about:
Hardworking Angeleno whose passions are my home, the coast, friends, travel.

My cozy hillside ocean-view home, a mere 5-minute walk to the beach, was lovingly renovated to embrace an elegant, midcentury modern mix with a casual coastal charm. 

There's nothing like hearing the ocean waves at night and waking up to the magic that is the Pacific ocean with views from every floor of this split-level home. I feel so blessed to live here and want to share that magic with you.  I also am inspired by art, traveling souls like myself, getting lost in a great book, a foreign city, or amidst an engaging conversation with friends over a wonderful meal. :)

If you decide to grace this space, I will personally show you around the house so that you may enjoy and respect it to its fullest.  Casa Castellammare has a wonderful "I'm on vacation" vibe while still being close to the city, whether you're here for work or pleasure..  It's a graceful and calming experience within a fully-appointed,  custom-furnished, top-of-the-line, very private home.

The house motto - as seen in one of the (Website hidden by Airbnb) Nice Or Leave. :)

Very close to the beach, mountains, Santa Monica, Malibu and all parts of the Westside of Los Angeles.

The space
The detached unit is above the garage with one flight of steps. This is a working art studio but not while guests are staying over. It’s a no-shoes and pet-free environment so it is always clean. The backyard BBQ is available for use with patio table and chairs. Coffee, tea and sparkling water available. The fire department is a close neighbor but they're reasonably quiet, friendly and helpful. There is ample free street parking. If you love hiking, the beach or surfing, you'll be stoked. I know all the good surf spots, beaches and trails and will give great advice on how to get anywhere in LA, what to see and where to eat.

We're located next to Palisades Village with lots of great shops, restaurants, cafes, grocery stores, and other amenities nearby. The saying goes, "If you're rich you live in Beverly Hills, if you're famous you live in Malibu, if you're lucky you live in the Palisades."

name_left: Santa Monica Adjacent Palisades Garden Guest House
description:
Pacific Palisades: the very best of both worlds! A small town feel, yet part of the second largest city in the United States – perfectly situated between Santa Monica in the south and Malibu to the north. The person who could not fall in love with the Palisades has never yet been born. Our lovely English cottage, nestled in the Palisades bluffs is the perfect getaway.

The space
The accommodation boasts an excellent location, 11 miles from LAX, 3 miles from Santa Monica with its pier, promenade, multiple shops, restaurants and theatres.

This is a gorgeous studio, set in the garden of a private house. Reliable Internet connection is provided for your convenience. There is a full bath with tub and shower, shampoo, conditioner and hair dryer. An iron and ironing board are also provided.

There is a modest kitchenette complete with microwave and refrigerator. Light snacks are provided on your arrival. Coffee and a variety of teas are included.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a family neighborhood. You will see mostly single family homes, children on bikes and skateboards, lots of trees, ocean views, and plentiful flower gardens. You can expect a warm hello in passing as pretty much the standard.
Very safe for walking any time of the day or night.
host_about:
Lucie Pearl Conolly

Born in Buenos Aires, raised in the United Kingdom, and, for 41 years a resident of California. Proud citizen of the United States, Los Angeles has been the home in which she raised her three sons. In addition to raising her family, for many years she worked as a school teacher. Now that all three of our sons are back in the Golden State, California is definitely home. These days retired from teaching, she loves to give hospitality. Living in one of the great cross road cities of the world, she has entertained people from everywhere, and expects that Airbnb will bolster that tradition.
 
Matthew Conolly
 
Born in England, educated from primary school through medical school in the London area, but spent a year and a half on post-doctoral research at Vanderbilt University in Nashville, Tennessee. There his growth in both medical science and Country and Western Music were stimulated. He then returned to England, married Lucie Pearl, and started a family. “There is a tide in the affairs of men” so goes the saying “which taken at the flood leads on to. . .” – in our case, California, and how exciting California has been – silicon valley, electric cars, (Hidden by Airbnb) , Space-X, pharmaceutical research! The list goes on and on. Our family has grown and spread, but after a period of more than 20 years, all three of our sons now once again live in California, making the Golden State most definitely home!!

name_left: Rare Mid Century Villa
description:
Luxuriate in a hot tub under the pine trees and stars of this 1959 California Villa. The floor-to-ceiling windows fill the home with light, highlighting the sleek mid century architecture and designer furniture. Ample gardens, orchards and patios surround this spacious home, weaving their way to the pool and spa. A perfect place to escape the city only minutes to the beach and a few feet from state park.

The space
My grandparents built this mid century modern gem in 1959 when land was abundant and everyone thought them crazy to be so "far out of town" (10 minutes from Santa Monica and Brentwood, 5 from the Palisades). They built our home at the end of a spoon canyon and feels so spacious and secluded yet it is close to everything. Built on an acre of land, we have a fruit orchard (oranges, lemons, peaches, plums, pears, and avocado), gardens with Australian tea trees, redwoods, eucalyptus and pines that reach into the gorgeous pool and hot tub.

Gues

This canyon includes an amazing hike with truly stunning views of LA and on a clear day you can see all the way to Catalina Island. The apt is also just a short 5-10mins walk to Will Rogers beach. You are a 2 mins walk to the Bluffs with it’s stunning views of the ocean. A 3mins drive to Palisades Village with it’s trendy new shopping mall.

The famous Sunday Farmers market at Pali High is a 3 mins walk away.

Our location is superb but we recommend having a car in LA.

host_about:
Lucie Pearl Conolly

Born in Buenos Aires, raised in the United Kingdom, and, for 41 years a resident of California. Proud citizen of the United States, Los Angeles has been the home in which she raised her three sons. In addition to raising her family, for many years she worked as a school teacher. Now that all three of our sons are back in the Golden State, California is definitely home. These days retired from teaching, she loves to give hospitality. Living in one of the great cross road cities of the world, she has entertained people from everywhere, and expects that Airbnb will bolster that tradition.
 
Matthew Conolly
 
Born in England, educated from primary school through medical school in the London area, but spent a year and a half on post-doctoral research at Vanderbilt University in Nashville, Tennessee. There his growth in both medical science and Country and Western Music were stimulated. He then returned to England, married Lucie Pearl, and started a family. “There is a tide in the affairs of men” so goes the saying “which taken at the flood leads on to. . .” – in our case, California, and how exciting California has been – silicon valley, electric cars, (Hidden by Airbnb) , Space-X, pharmaceutical research! The list goes on and on. Our family has grown and spread, but after a period of more than 20 years, all three of our sons now once again live in California, making the Golden State most definitely home!!

neighborhood_overview: "The Village" as it's referred to by locals, is known for its relaxed, low-key vibe, where real people co-mingle with the rich and famous.  Celebrity sightings are not guaranteed, but don't be surprised if you find yourself standing next to your favorite star at the market or coffee house.  Nearby Temescal Canyon Park offers hundreds of acres of unspoiled natural beauty and hiking trails, seasonal streams and waterfalls, and a sweeping view of the Pacific Ocean at the top of the  "Loop Trail".  Santa Monica State beach is a 15 minute walk down the hill.  Or take our local bus #9 to and from the Beach if you prefer.
host_about: I'm a 5th generation Californian and have been blessed to live in Pacific Palisades --"Where the mountains meet the Sea"--since 1981.  I love hosting guests so they too can experience the beauty of Pacific Palisades and all of what Southern has to offer.

neighborhood_overview:
While the quiet and serene St. Andrews West is hidden away atop the bluffs of Pacific Palisades, a brisk 10 minute walk puts you smack dab in the middle of Downtown Pacific Palisades with plenty of restaurants, coffee shops, shopping and a dine-in theater. Don’t be surprised if you bump into a few movie stars along the way, Jennifer Garner, Ben Affleck, Dennis Quaid, Tom Hanks, Hilary Swank and Jamie Lee Curtis are all locals and call the Palisades home.

Check out the local fare -

https://palisadesvillageca.com
host_about:
I was born and raised right here at the beach in Pacific Palisades and grew up in this Williamsburg Colonial style home my father built in the 1940's. My parents both had the gift of hospitality and without a doubt it's been passed on to me. I LOVE to entertain and when my friends from all over the world come to LA, I'm the designated master of ceremonies.

From Disneyland to Venice Beach to College Pubs to The Magic Castle, I have always been the straw that stirs the drinks when it comes to experiencing this town from the inside out.

I was a child actor in the 70's, played in bands as a singer/songwriter, I'm a writer and filmmaker now and I believe that very little in this life is more valuable than the memories we make when we encounter and connect with other people. 

I'm fascinated by great stories. It's food for my soul. I can't wait to hear yours!

Stunning 1920s Mediterranean house with 180 degree ocean and coastline views. Just a few minutes walk to the beach. Great for large groups.

The house is situated on a hillside in the Castellammare area of Pacific Palisades near Malibu. Just a short drive to all the shops/restaurants in Santa Monica and Palisades village.

Owner will consider pet for small additional fee. Please ask first.

The space
The house was originally owned by a famous Hollywood set designer so it has tons of character. Many pieces in the house were used in old Hollywood movies.

The layout of the house is incredibly unique, which makes it perfect for couples or large groups. Every bedroom has direct outside access, which allows excellent flexibility. All rooms have a direct ocean view.

Here is a breakdown of the house:

LIVING ROOM (main floor)
- Stunning ocean views with large windows that open to let in the ocean breeze
- La
neighborhood_overview: The house is in the upscale residential community of Pacific Palisades. It's conveniently located just five minutes away from Santa Monica with the pier and 3rd Street Promenade shops/restaurants. Continue south a few minutes form Santa Monica to reach Venice Beach and the famous Boardwalk. Take Sunset Boulevard into Beverly Hills/West Hollywood/Hollywood (20-40 minutes) or drive just a couple miles north to Malibu. There's a grocery store close to the house...about 1/4 mile away. It's also about 1/4 mile away from the Self Realization Fellowship spiritual center.
host_about:

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Pacific Palisades, a coastal neighborhood on the West side of Los Angeles. Primarily a residential area, the laid-back community overlooks the ocean. Surrounded by three state parks and miles of sandy beach, this is an ideal area for wine connoisseurs and nature lovers. For instance, Temescal Gateway Park has an easy hiking trail that leads to a beautiful waterfall and the Will Rogers State Beach stretches along the Pacific Coast Highway. The small downtown core of Pacific Palisades has cafés, restaurants, high-end boutiques, yoga facilities, and home decor shops.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Why take a chance picking & choosing between so many individual hosts when you can enjoy the highest-quality guest experience from one consistent host -- Blueground. We are a global real estate tech company offering +3500 fully-equipped & furnished apartments for a month, a year or longer across 12 cities and 3 continents. Centrally-based in vibrant neighborhoods, each home is tech-powered & furnished by our expert Interior Design teams. Enjoy at-home amenities like high-speed WiFi, a fully-stocked kitchen, smart TV, premium bedding/towels, quality toiletries, and depending on the apartment choice -- artisan coffee, bluetooth speakers & select building amenities such as pools, gyms & outdoor spaces. From meal, wine & grocery delivery to laundry & dry-cleaning right to your door, our guests can choose from a number of service benefits. Each apartment is safe & professionally sanitized.

During your stay
Driven by a mission to help you show up & start living, Blueground is proud to host thousands of guests around the world in the following cities: New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens.
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours to enjoy; and for additional support, our Client Experience team is available via phone, email & our Guest App through which you can schedule additional cleanings, request fresh towels/linens, submit maintenance requests, and view neighborhood recommendations. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name_left: The Heart House
description:
The Heart House is located in Santa Monica Canyon. This charming bungalow is perfect for couples or families with 2 children. Two Bedrooms, two bathrooms, a King size bed in the Master Bedroom and two twins in the 2nd Bedroom. We are happy to accommodate 5 people as long as one is a small child that can use a pack and play.

The space
The Heart House does not have central air conditioning. Because we are located so close to the beach we rarely even need it. All the rooms are also equipped with ceiling fans that do a wonderful job cooling the rooms. We do have a portable unit that we can set up for you. It will cool the master bedroom down but not the whole house.

Seven restaurants are easily accessible within a 2 minute walk, as well as a small market and liquor store.

No keys to deal with or lose during your stay. Both the Front Gate and Front Door to the house is controlled by an Electronic Door lock and both use the same pass-code,
neighborhood_overview:
The Santa Monica Canyon, historically known for its artists writers, and musicians as well as Hollywood industry types, retains a charm and casual sophistication for which Los Angeles is so famous. You will immediately feel relaxed and at home.
Not only is your ideal vacation bungalow close to the beach, but you also have easy access to Santa Monica, Pacific Palisades, Malibu and all of Los Angeles, including West Los Angeles, Westwood, Brentwood and all of Western Los Angeles County. UCLA, Pepperdine, The Getty Museum, Third Street Promenade in Santa Monica, Westwood, Beverly Hills, Hollywood and Universal Studios are all an easy drive. And Six Flags Magic Mountain, Disneyland and Knott’s Berry Farm are all within an hour’s drive. And if Art and Culture is your thing, there are too many places to list here within an hour’s drive.

name_left: Santa Monica Canyon 2BD Ocean View Beach Bungalow
description:
Hidden right between affluent Pacific Palisades and trendy Santa Monica, this gorgeous bungalow sits just above the Pacific Ocean, offers most amazing views over the beach and canyons, a separate entrance and a short distance to the popular street shopping mall. You are only a few minutes walk to the beach, hike trails and the popular Santa Monica stairs are right next door! Stunning viewpoints, breathtaking sunsets and nearby beach and surf - a true Californian experience!

The space
A few flights of stairs will lead you to this gorgeous bungalow, designed with love to reflect true California lifestyle, offer maximum comfort and relaxing, truly unforgettable experience.
There is free off street parking and free usage of funboards with an option to rent a surfboard if you are a true ocean lover!

Guest access
The bungalow is located on the left side of the house, has a separate entrance and offers a convenient self-check-in option.
neighborhood_overview:
Located between two most desirable locations in Los Angeles, the studio offers the best of both worlds: slow-paced, peaceful and calm beach lifestyle of Pacific Palisades and vibrant, trendy city life of Santa Monica!

A short walk to the south will bring you to Ocean Ave, westernmost street of Santa Monica. Located high, just above Pacific Coast Hwy, it runs parallel to Palisades Park offering a beautiful running path and sweeping ocean views. From here you can get to the Third Street Promenade shopping mall, numerous bars, restaurants and nightclubs as well as The Santa Monica Pier, a landmark, famous for its souvenir shops, kids attractions and open-air night entertainment. Walk over the bridge and you will find yourself on the Santa Monica beach promenade and Annenberg Community Beach House that offers a pool house with changing areas, a splash pad, gardens, beach volleyball and tennis courts, a children's play area, public restrooms, beach rentals, and a cafe.
host_about:
Douglas and Laura Banty have been married for 6 years and now live in the beautiful canyon in Santa Monica.  Originally from South Carolina,  we traveled all over the world but have found my home in Los Angeles where I have been residing since 2001. Laura is a dentist, practicing in Oxnard, Ventura as well as in south LA, as her own dental practice SOLA Kids Dental. I aim to create a unique style to make the dental experience fun and comfortable for kids and young adults of all ages and needs. 
When I am not hanging with my patients, you will find me relaxing at the beach with my husband Doug or exploring mountain trails with my dog Lucy. I am a true ocean lover and love spending my early mornings in the water, surfing :-)

name_left: Peaceful Paradise With Mountain View and Full Kitchen
description: Step back in time in this 70s-inspired space designed to make the most of the view. Thoughtfully collected vintage pieces blend with numerous plants, plentiful books, and a record player. Watch bountiful wildlife through the windows.
neighborhood_overview: Stroll the secret trail nestled moments away to meet some friendly neighbors and dogs. The gentle ocean breeze means that locals call this area "climate-perfect Fernwood." From here on the west side of Topanga, it's under 15 minutes to the beach.
host_about:
I live in Topanga Canyon with my husband and my two little dogs, surrounded by nature. I love gardening, cooking, exploring different parts of LA and trying new restaurants, lazing at the beach, and most of all, I love animals and helping them in anyway possible. We often have one or two foster dogs at home. 

I try to travel as much as possible and enjoy staying at Airbnbs so I can meet locals and learn the secret spots! We recently decided to open up our home as an Airbnb host. We have two unique spaces, both filled with plants and surrounded by nature. We love nature and strive to reduce our impact when creating these spaces, so most of the items are sourced second hand from the 70's and 80's.

We are excited to meet new people and help make their time here as fun and relaxing as possible!

name_left: Paradise in Palisades
description:
Tucked away in the heart of the Alphabet Streets, located moments from Palisades Village, this gated, thoughtfully remodeled Scandinavian retreat, emphasizes country charm with a minimalist modern aesthetic, while maintaining integrity and character.

The space
Flooded with natural light, upon entry the eye capturing vaulted ceilings with beam detail throughout, frame the picturesque open living and dining area. The effortless flow from the upgraded chef’s kitchen accented with butcher block countertops, to the lushly landscaped backyard oasis, creates a true entertainer's delight. Relish in the indoor-outdoor living this chic property has to offer, complete with an outdoor kitchen, dining area, gardens, pool, and spa. An impressive, warming home, with artistic and designer finishes, this home includes three double bedrooms in the main house, an office, a private guest house bungalow with a kitchenette and ¾ bath, perfect for entertaining you and your guests.

host_about: I have traveled all over the world and can attest that California is one of the most beautiful places that one could visit. Dana Point is an absolute jewel. It has beautiful beaches and a stunning marina, where once can rent a kayak, go deep sea fishing, or take the Catalina Express to Catalina Island. A great hike would be to leave the house and walk down to the water. The views are so breathtaking that it's easy to get exhilarated. In addition to the scenic marina and the exceptional views from the hills up above, Dana Point is renowned for some of the best beaches in the world. It is a friendly and a very happy environment and I would be happy to introduce  visitors to Dana Point and California in general. I have lived most of my life in Southern California and I am still excited about it.

neighborhood_overview:
Staying in Pacific Palisades. Our local guide given to you at check in outlines all our great local cafes and restaurants.
Pacific Palisades is one of the most sought-after neighborhoods in LA. With the picturesque Santa Monica Mountains to the south, this small residential community boasts incredible views of the Pacific Ocean as well as some of the best hiking and mountain biking trails in the city. The locals are mostly affluent families, celebrities and influencers, and the Palisades offer a quiet refuge away from the noise and hustle of the rest of the city. If you’re looking for a party, the Palisades is definitely not the place to be as the majority of the town winds down around 9pm. However, if you’re looking for beautiful homes with great access to pristine beaches and mountains - look no further! Be sure to check out the Getty Villa on PCH, an oasis of Greco-Roman art and architecture with stunning ocean views.
host_about:
Caroline moved to the USA in the 90's and  started First Class Properties LA and Life's a beach to assist her many UK-based entertainment industry friends looking for short-term and long-term accommodations in Los Angeles. In the passes 10 years since, Caroline has acquired a collection of beautiful rental properties and now caters to a large number of select clients from around the globe.

Caroline hand-picks every property with the primary criteria being stellar views, safe and sought-after locations, walkability, and a general “wow” factor. Many of the properties have fantastic amenities, including pools, spas and gyms, and all of the properties have easy onsite parking. As a professional interior designer, Caroline prefers minimalistic and easy living, a design aesthetic that is immediately identifiable when you set foot into any of her residences.

We loved being able to cook breakfast and have little meals at the cottage, or go to whole foods for fresh, organic meals. The place was so cozy and Dary is excellent at making a small space feel big and comfortable. This place has everything! Great stay and very affordable. Dary greeted us upon our arrival and made us feel welcome. It's a safe space and very peaceful. You're just moments away from the Venice Beach, great shopping, Gold's Gym, Santa Monica, and much more. When we come back, we plan on booking with Dary again! ”
~Brenna~
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

“I stayed in this lovely place for several weeks and loved every minute of it. Upon my arrival I found all kinds of surprise goodies which was so generous of Dary. Whenever I had a question or issue, Dary was right there. In addition to an attentive host, i loved the cottage's location - it is safe, private, beautiful, and central to everything. The bed is large and comfortable. The kitchen has all the basics. And the big window is fabulous for light and fresh air. As a bonus, Superba is right around the corner - truly one of LA's best choice for breakfast (pastries and lattes to die for), lunch or dinner. Everyone I met at Dary's was so friendly and interesting. Really, I could not ask for more. This is a great AIRBNB!!! ”
~Tracey~
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Tiki Love Shack
“Dary was a fantastic host. The residence is beautiful and very relaxing. The living space was very cozy. The decor was warm and inviting with an extremely comfortable bed. It was convenient to have a kitchen space with so many cooking basics. The bathroom was very clean and stocked with essentials. It was cold while I was staying but there was a heater and the lofted bed area stayed warm all night. I had an easy time getting to the beach, Hollywood and downtown L.A.. There was always plenty of free parking in front of the home. The little extras Dary provide made the experience exceptional. I highly recommend staying here if you have a chance.”
~ David ~

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

“This place was adorable. Everything was easy & Dary was very attentive with my questions and with communication. Everything was clean and cozy and I felt safe and happy being there. This is perfect for 1-2 people who want to stay in Venice, yet be close to 101 to hit up Marina Del Rey or Santa Monica too. (Quickly) There was outside space to use if needed and extra supplies in the room if you forgot anything. All of the instructions for TV/Internet etc were very easy to understand. I appreciate a nice, clean place to lay my head at night and this was the best experience I've had at an Airbnb location so far! Thanks Dary! I will stay again next time I am in town!”    - Dana - 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

“Dary was communicative, friendly and an overall great host. The location was great and the apartment was on the back of the house so felt very private even though there were other units close by. I would definitely recommend staying here! The unit was so well done, clean and cosy. we loved it! thanks for being a great host. ”    - Martha -

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

“We absolutely loved our stay. We are driving the coast for our honeymoon and after the wedding madness needed a cozy place to stay. We immediately felt at home in this adorable yard and room. Especially loved brewing a pot of coffee and having a slow morning in this quiet adorable place. Thanks Dary!”
~ Meghan ~ 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

“This is the second time I have stayed with Dary. The location of her rentals in proximity of the beach is FANTASTIC! Abbot Kinney street (with great restaurants and shops) is a close walk away and leads right down to the beach. She makes your stay hassle free by having everything you need and making access to the flat a breeze. Parking is also not an issue if you have a vehicle; there's plenty of free street parking. I would stay with Dary again anytime... and probably will in the future! ”
~ Ondrea ~ 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

“Dary's place is absolutely adorable. Secluded, spacious with all the amenities needed. What a gem! ”
~ Jessica ~ 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

“Perfect place for two! This apartment had everything you could need, from minor toiletries to snacks, laundry, cable and wi-fi. A bunch of awesome bicycles and boogie boards were available to use as well as outdoor seating areas and a firepit. The loft was very comfortable and very clean. It was nicely decorated and the entire property was so charming. Dary is an excellent host, and we felt right at home. We look forward to being a repeat visitor and we plan on sending any friends in the area her way too! ”
~Sharon~
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

“With Dary´s place I found my perfect place for visiting LA. I will come back for sure! The place is exactly as shown in the pictures. Everthing works and it is all clean. What you cannot see is that the cottage is located in a very nice neighborhood. It is quite, but you are still in the middle of everything. Dary is a wonderful host. She is very friendly, supportive, helpful and always available. ”
~ Hilke ~
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Hi Dary, it's Ariane and Cat. We love your place and have made ourselves at home! Thanks again for having us!

host_about:
Hi, my name is Stuart and I'm a born and raised New Yorker living in Los Angeles with my family. Serial entrepreneur and owner of LA's most trusted and popular short-term rental company, Stay Awhile Villas.    I have traveled the world and love passing along my best travel experiences to our guests by making you feel like a member of an expensive travel club.   We have a beautiful collection of luxury residences including some of our own in the most popular neighborhoods in Los Angeles, Beverly Hills, Pacific Palisades, Bel Air, Hollywood Hills, and of course Malibu.  We are extremely accomplished hosts on Airbnb with the following accolades:

   -  9 x Airbnb Superhost, 10 Airbnb Plus Listings.
   -  10 LUX Listings
    - 779+ 5-Star reviews

Our properties have been featured in Travel + Leisure, Angeleno, People Magazine, FOX, NBC, Wall Street Journal, Daily Mail, TMZ, History Channel, Mansion Global, Los Angeles Times, New York Times, and more.  Our guests include some of the most famous film and music personalities, C level executives of Fortune 500 companies, and Royal Families. 

Whether you are coming here for vacation, business, or pleasure we are here to make your stay as simple and luxurious as possible.  We offer the following services to our guests via our concierge partner(*additional fees may apply):

    - Personal Chefs and Catering
    - Luxury Dining Recommendations and Reservations
    - Vacation Planning and Excursion Recommendations 
    - Villa Pre-Stocking (Groceries and Personal Item Requests) 
    - Luxury Vehicle Rentals 
    - Chauffeur Services
    - Yacht/Jet Charters 
   

See all our Airbnb portfolio of listings here: www.airbnb.com/p/los-angeles-vacation-rentals   I would also recommend you read our incredible reviews - https://www.airbnb.com/users/reviews/ (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Thank you for taking the time to read a little about us and we look forward to working with you. 

Stuart Heller and the Stay Awhile Team

description:
Location is everything! Our quiet, private guest apartment is the perfect “jumping off” spot for the westside of Los Angeles. This one-bedroom unit is located in a classic California home. It is only 0.5 miles to town, 1 mile to the Santa Monica Mountains, and 1.5 miles to the beach. Palisades Village is within walking distance featuring markets, shops, restaurants, pharmacies and banks. Metro #602 is 2 blocks away, and Lime scooters are available around the Village.

The space
Park your car on the street, close the gate behind you, walk downstairs – and a comfortable king size bed, fresh towels and snacks await you. After you regenerate, head out for local activities:
Will Rogers - polo game/hikes
Lake Shrine- meditative walks
Temescal Canyon - hike to waterfall
Pacific Ocean - swim/surf or walk/bike along paved pathway
Theaters both film/stage
Palisades Park - tennis or picnic
Sunday Farmers’ Market
Bicycles are avail

The space
Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this two-bedroom apartment. O
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Pacific Palisades, a coastal neighborhood on the West side of Los Angeles. Primarily a residential area, the laid-back community overlooks the ocean. Surrounded by three state parks and miles of sandy beach, this is an ideal area for wine connoisseurs and nature lovers. For instance, Temescal Gateway Park has an easy hiking trail that leads to a beautiful waterfall and the Will Rogers State Beach stretches along the Pacific Coast Highway. The small downtown core of Pacific Palisades has cafés, restaurants, high-end boutiques, yoga facilities, and home decor shops.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Why take a chance picking & choosing between so many individual hosts when you can enjoy the highest-quality guest experience from one consistent host -- Blueground. We are a global real estate tech company offering +3500 fully-equipped & furnished apartments for a month, a year or longer across 12 cities and 3 continents. Centrally-based in vibrant neighborhoods, each home is tech-powered & furnished by our expert Interior Design teams. Enjoy at-home amenities like high-speed WiFi, a fully-stocked kitchen, smart TV, premium bedding/towels, quality toiletries, and depending on the apartment choice -- artisan coffee, bluetooth speakers & select building amenities such as pools, gyms & outdoor spaces. From meal, wine & grocery delivery to laundry & dry-cleaning right to your door, our guests can choose from a number of service benefits. Each apartment is safe & professionally sanitized.

During your stay
Driven by a mission to help you show up & start living, Blueground is proud to host thousands of guests around the world in the following cities: New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens.
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours to enjoy; and for additional support, our Client Experience team is available via phone, email & our Guest App through which you can schedule additional cleanings, request fresh towels/linens, submit maintenance requests, and view neighborhood recommendations. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

Brand new natural modern tiny home tucked away on 1 acre magical forest property with direct private access to state park trail. Wrap around deck provides chic outdoor dining and lounge space complete with stone fireplace. Gorgeous eclectic landscape including boulder lookout & cactus garden. Totally private property with on-premise parking. Perfect retreat!

The space
Soak in the magic of our Topanga State Park forest and get the real tiny living experience in this award-winning tiny home, hand crafted by Made Relative. Brand new indoor and outdoor space designed thoughtful with everything you need for a comfortable stay at the edge of Fernwood. Perfect for a romantic getaway in our vibrant canyon village just 5 min from Inn of the Seventh Ray, or for a much needed retreat to rest & recharge surrounded by Mother Nature. Enter
neighborhood_overview:
Located in the Fernwood area of the Canyon, Montau Drive is one of the most grounded neighborhoods that maintains cooler temperatures due to its proximity to the ocean and the sheer volume of plants and trees that shade it, all while still showing off sweeping canyon views.

We will leave personal instructions for some trails that are walkable from the house (one of the reasons we fell in love with the property). This property has direct access to a trail into the State Park. Other favorite hikes you can drive to include Tuna Canyon Park, Red Rock Park, and Topanga Canyon Park.

The tiny home is a 4 minute drive to our local Mimosa Cafe. We also like Topanga Living Cafe and Cafe 27. Restaurants nearby also include Cholada Thai, the Canyon Bistro, the Inn at the Seventh Ray in Topanga, and the Reel Inn, Malibu Farm Pier Cafe, Nobu, and Gjelina on the PCH. There's even wine tasting at the Rosenthal Winery. All of these are within a 5 to 10 minute drive.

Cul
host_about: Fun loving, triple bottom line founder and CEO who wants to make the most of life! I always do Airbnb when travelling for business or with family and friends to get the true local experience. I'm also a host myself for our houses in Hawaii and California!

We have a brand new wireless router with extremely fast wireless Internet access at 85mb per sec. We also have a new, very reliable tankless hot water heater that never runs out of hot water for the bath/shower..

Relax in total comfort at our free standing, non attached Topanga Guest House. Kick back and enjoy the abundant nature that surrounds us. Located between the Pacific Ocean and the Valley you are also minutes away from every modern convience LA has to offer.

The space
Very Large Detached Guest House on a beautiful property that is located in the middle of the Santa Monica Mountains. This Guest House is completely separate, not under the main house, you will not hear footsteps above you from the main house. You will hear us when we leave and arrive as the garage shares a wall. The Guest House has 4 separate rooms, Kitchen / TV Room (with 2 single beds / trundle bed) / Downstairs large Bedroom with Queen bed, and Bathroom. One of our reviewers wrote "Best Guest House for the money in Topanga.. we checked them all..." It has decks overlooking views of the trees and the seasonal creek below.. It is located next to Topanga State Park with nearby access to trai
neighborhood_overview: Topanga is a fantastic place.  I grew up in New Mexico on a ranch with no electricity, no running water, and no telephone.   It was an environment where you truly grew to appreciate nature.  I live and work in Los Angeles, Topanga keeps me in contact with nature and my roots.
host_about:
I am a Lover of Art, Photography, Adventure, and Discovery.  I am a Director of Photography in the film and television industry who's credits include the Oscar Nominated "Invisible War", "Who Killed The Electric Car" and many others.

The only thing more important to me then these pursuits are my Family who allow me to rediscover all that is dear to me on a daily basis.   I am married to a wonderful woman, and have 2 beautiful and smart children.  I love to travel and experience.  Learning should always be a passion.

name_left: Topanga Secret Cottage
description:
The cottage is a large one-bedroom guesthouse, barely visible from our main house. Very private with gorgeous canyon views.

The space
We call our guesthouse the "Secret Cottage" because you almost can't believe you can find this much tranquility in Los Angeles County. A simple, rustic kind of elegance prevails in this unique hideaway, accessible by a narrow, bumpy road the likes of which are rarely seen in the first world. Only a mile and a half from the main road, you'll feel like you've gone back in time as you pass horses, goats and sheep along the way. The house has 1 large, well appointed BR with a tempurpedic mattress and bamboo floors. Comfortable bath with antique vanity connects to both bedroom and living room. Spacious living room has a comfortable sofa bed, and an inflatable mattress is also available. Three sets of French doors open to a small deck. A full "foodie" kitchen comes with everything you'll need to cook gourmet meals, usually including hone
host_about: We are a family of 4. Mike is a cinematographer in Hollywood. Lynn is a documentary writer/director. We have two great kids: Jackson is 20 and Nora is 16. We also have 2 dogs, Loki & Hendricks, and a dozen or so chickens.  We are really enjoying having airbnb guests at the cabin.  Everyone has been lovely and very appreciative of our unique locale. We love to travel ourselves, so it's great fun to meet others who share that passion. But don't worry... we mostly leave you alone to enjoy the place!

name_left: Malibu Hideaway, Santa Monica Mtns.
description:
Perched on a mountain over Topanga Canyon, privacy, views and nature surrounds you!

The space
Close to it all, yet worlds away... This hidden cottage is perched atop a glorious bluff on a 23 acre gated mountaintop estate overlooking the lush Santa Monica Mountains. Escape down the country lane into complete privacy and serenity, yet be less than a mile to restaurants, entertainment, yoga and stores. Hike in 10,000 acre Topanga State park or take in the many nearby beaches. Shop the high-end boutiques of Malibu or Santa Monica, enjoy glorious sunsets and misty mornings or bike the hundreds of miles of trails of Topanga State Park straight from the front door. Horse riding facilities, theater, surf lessons, kite boarding, artist studios, seasonal festivals, Docent-led nature walks, miles of beaches all within 30 minutes of studios and Hollywood.

The Cottage has full kitchen, dishwasher and laundry.
2 bedrooms, one bath. The bath has a large ti
neighborhood_overview:
First some random things we like to do in LA with kids:

Ride bikes on the path in Santa Monica - rent them from the shop near the pier and ride them all the way to Venice beach (if you are really ambitious you can go as far as Manhattan Beach)
or, for a more of a canyon work out, rent them from Topanga Creek Bycicles (phone number hidden) and join one of the weekend group rides that start from the shop. Very strenuous, but amazing.
Farmers market on Sundays in Santa Monica on Main St. - super fun, good food, music, people watching
and don't miss our own Farmer's Market on Fridays at the Inn of The Seventh Ray from 9-1
Go to the pool at Annenberg Comminity Beach House (eat breakfast at Back on The Beach, swim, read by the pool, run on the beach) or Calabasas pool if it's cold at the beach, it is sure to be hot in Calabasas!
Griffith Park observatory in Hollywood - short hike or drive right up, cool views of the city
Take a scenic drive on PCH to
host_about: The Crawfords... Hiking. The ocean, movies. Gardening, urban farming, snow chasing, wine by the fire!

name_left: Modern retreat in Topanga Canyon
description:
The home sits in the hills of Topanga Canyon just a few miles up from the beach. Enjoy this newly remodeled completely custom home. So close yet so far. All the amenities you'd expect from a high-end resort yet the comfort of being in your own home.

You have State Park trails at the end of the block and the town center, Pine Tree Circle within a brisk walk. You really don't need a car to enjoy this place.

The space
The house sleeps 2 couples comfortably (queen size beds) and the office functions as a 3rd bedroom with a comfortable daybed that converts into 2 single or a double mattress.

A perfect weekend getaway, worlds removed from the hustle & bustle of L.A yet reachable within minutes. 15 minutes to Santa Monica or Malibu to the South, or to the North, 15 minutes to Calabasas and Woodland Hills and access to world class shopping and entertainment.

The house can be rented for day time purposes (yoga retreat / workshops) or to ho
host_about:
Welcome to Topanga Canyon,

When my wife Sara and I first moved here, we were taken in by a community that is both artistic and supportive and we wish to share this with you in our beautifully remodeled home. As founders of the Topanga Film Festival, we have shared this home with Filmmakers from all over the world, now it's YOUR turn.

name_left: Pristine Cottage Nestled in the Topanga Woods
description:
Feel the gentle ocean breeze in the UV protected patio overlooking herb and native planted garden. The home has a beach cottage feel with vintage white-washed wooden floors, oceanic pillows, an antique chest, and a vintage planter with a mirror.

To offer you a safe & pristine bungalow, Airbnb’s enhanced cleaning protocol is implemented. It includes sanitizing high-touch surfaces, use of CDC approved cleaners and disinfectants, use of protective gear to help prevent cross-contamination, extensive cleaning checklists for every room. Cleaning supplies on hand so you can stay clean as your stay.
neighborhood_overview: The bungalow is set in Topanga with sprawling canyon views. Enveloped in natural beauty, it’s minutes from the beach and surfing hot spots, including Malibu, Pacific Palisades, Santa Monica, and Woodland Hills.
host_about: Born and raised in the south of  France, I am a linguist, love all languages and cultures.  I practice yoga, hike, dance, write.  I love the homes I have created for myself, enjoy maintaining them and am constantly beautifying them for myself and all who visit.  In the process I have developed a network of professionals with personality, integrity and competence that I am happy to hire when needed.  Although I can guarantee you complete privacy, I am usually around if you need anything and am quick to respond.  As my guests, you might enjoy special details within my homes and property.  It is a joy to share the beautiful surrounding I live in and lifestyle they afford.  I Recently spent two months traveling through Nepal, India and Sri Lanka with my youngest daughter (booked a few nights in Jaipur through airbnb, met a really cool host!!)  Since I started hosting , I have enjoyed  guests from various States and countries;  the world coming to me in this way, and being part of  Los Angeles where all cultures are represented, I feel I don't need to travel that much anymore.  Hosting is a creative expression for me and I love to exceed my guests expectations.

name_left: The Topanga "French Quarters"
description:
Bright and spacious studio apartment with a fireplace and full bath that features a luxurious claw-foot bathtub and a separate shower. We've decorated this space in our vision of an authentic French apartment with some Topanga ambiance mixed in. Fringed lamps, King size plush mattress, authentic original bathroom door from the 1st settlers of this historic property.

The space
This charming apartment is decorated in French style. It features a comfortable king size bed, lovely decorative stone fireplace, beautiful antique dining table and a full bath. The private bathroom features a claw foot bathtub and separate shower. There is a full kitchen with cookware next door in our main house that is available to you anytime.

The French Quarters is a lovely mix of antique and modern, nestled in the mountains with surrounding lush woodlands, creeks, and nearby hiking trails. There is a beautiful view of the canyon in the daytime and an abundance of stars at
neighborhood_overview:
The world famous Inn of the Seventh Ray is just down the street, with fine dining next to a flowing stream. They have a wonderful Sunday brunch.

************************************************************************
Recommended Local Attractions:

Restaurants just a few minutes drive:
Mimosa Café – local coffee and pastry – Topanga hangout
Waterlily Café - sandwiches and espresso
Froggy’s Fish Market - great Topanga atmosphere indoors and outdoors, wide assortment of food. Unfortunately only open infrequently on weekends.
Abuelitas – Mexican food, local bands.
Inn of the Seventh Ray – gourmet new age brunch – pricey but lovely outdoor creekside dining.
Canyon Bistro – gourmet French California cuisine
Rocco’s Italian – good pizza takeout or sit down restaurant

A few miles north on Topanga Canyon Blvd:
Topanga Table - breakfast and lunch - eat outside with your dog at your table!
Topanga Living Cafe
host_about: Founder of this lovely paradise in the mountains.   Enjoys working with essential oils that we create right here on the land.   Scientist, Futurist, Dad

name_left: 2 Bedroom gem between mountain & ocean
description:
Malibu adjacent unique 2 bedroom gem set in the natural beauty of sprawling canyons, a short drive to the beach. Loads of vintage charm with tasteful modern upgrades, offering various environments where nature and comfort congregate harmoniously. One bedroom can be set up as 2 single day beds or 1 king size bed.

The space
Once the home of Mickey Rooney, this Topanga gem is wonderfully situated for gentle ocean breezes in a "climate-perfect" area. Enveloped in natural beauty, with its own poetry at any time of day or year, it invites one to retreat in tranquil simplicity and comfort, while remaining within minutes to civilization. The property features a detached bungalow, which can be booked by a different party or by the same party, eg. traveling couples, friends, or couple with mother-in law, or nanny. See the "Pristine Cottage Nestled in the Topanga Woods" listing if interested in booking both dwellings.

It is located minutes from the beach and
neighborhood_overview: There are about 7 restaurants in towns including grill, fish, ethnic, spiritual, warm lively cafes and quaint boutiques, Farmer's Market.  Also within short distance is Lake Shrine, a breathtaking meditation garden and lake with swans - one of Los Angeles hidden treasures.  You can drive, ride, or walk through the Santa Monica mountain to get there!  The Canyon is strewn with stunning trails to hike or mountain bike.  Should you long for beautiful beaches and surfing hot spots, the ocean will be calling...  6 minutes away.  There is a coin laundry up Topanga Canyon on the corner of Ventura Blvd, a dry cleaner in Topanga Center, 5 minutes away.

name_left: Beautiful Guesthouse with pool/Jacuzzi in Mountain
description:
Enjoy our beautiful Topanga cottage style Guesthouse with french doors leading out to waterfall pool, Jacuzzi and rose garden. The cottage, featuring vaulted ceilings, kitchen, cozy loft bedroom and bath is located on a serene property. The pool is heated only in the summer though the beauty of being nestled in the mountains with a fire can't be beat.

The space
Enjoy our beautiful Topanga cottage style Guesthouse with french doors leading out to waterfall pool, Jacuzzi and rose garden. The cottage, featuring vaulted ceilings, kitchen, cozy loft bedroom and bath is located on a serene property with mountain view decks and beautiful gardens, while just minutes from the beach. We are nestled in the Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area for hiking or biking some of the most beautiful trails, or drive to the beach and enjoy the ocean experience. This rental includes use of a pool and Jacuzzi. We are 15 minutes from Malibu town,15 minutes from Santa Monica
neighborhood_overview: We live in an amazing canyon! There are amazing hiking/biking  trails all around here that range from full ocean views to wooded trails peppered with beautiful rock formations. There is the http://theatricum.com which has the Sheakspeare and other classics throughout the year.

name_left: Beautiful guest house in Topanga
description:
Very clean guest house in a large, private yard. It is a really comfortable home for 2 adults and family. The guest house is super quiet, has a modern interior, great bathroom & bedroom, full kitchen & living room. It's a great value- especially when you consider hotel prices in Santa Monica, and we're 10 minutes from the beach!

The space
The guest house is really nice- people love it because it's so comfortable, practical and quiet. There are 3 rooms in the guest house: 1- Large bedroom with a big and really comfortable bed, 2- kitchen with a living room which has a very comfy pullout couch, 3- a great bathroom with shower. It's a really nice family space as you also have a large, private deck on the back of the guest house, for dining or suntanning. The location is awesome as you're central to all of LA, though you're in a quiet little neighbourhood.

Guest access
You have full access to a washer/dryer, your own large private deck, the who
neighborhood_overview: The location is fantastic. We're 10 minutes to the San Fernando Valley, 10 minutes to the beach, 20 minutes to Santa Monica, 40 minutes to LAX. You're really central to everything here, though you'll feel like you're living in a park.
host_about: I'm a Canadian guy married to a Swiss gal, Ursula. We love the mountains and the beach: skiing, surfing, biking- anything outdoors in nature. Here at home in Topanga, we do lots of hiking and biking right out the front gate of our property. Ursi works in finance, I work in economics and data analytics. We're quiet though we definitely enjoy a good bottle of wine. We love living in Topanga because it's so peaceful to be living in a nice environment, so close to the beach, Santa Monica and the rest of LA.

name_left: Charming Mountain Guest House
description:
Two-story guest house in Topanga with mountain views, peaceful and just 5 miles from the Topanga Beach and PCH. We are surrounded by greenery and wildlife not too far from the village of Topanga. Perfect for a quick get away or a vacation in nature.

The space
Charming 2-Story Guest House adjacent to main house available for rental year-round for stays as short as 3 nights to as long as 6 months. Separate entrance for guests. 1 bedroom 1 bathroom with bath tub/shower and kitchenette. Washer/Dryer available for stays of 2 weeks or longer. Beautiful views, cathedral ceilings, flat screen TV, internet and wifi included, hard wood floors with cute, cozy electric wood stove in bedroom. Lots of sun light, windows, wild-life, starry nights and peaceful calm to enjoy while you stay in eclectic Topanga! Close to many hiking and biking locations and only 5 miles to Topanga Beach. Malibu and Santa Monica only a few miles further. Village of Topanga is only quarter mile away
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is eclectic. It is an old hippy hangout from the 70's so it has lots of interesting history and appeal. We love being so close to the city yet feeling like you are somewhere else completely.  Wonderful hiking, a beautiful out door theater and the beach just down the road!
host_about: Andrea is a Songwriter and Certified Hypnotherapist. Peter is a Manager and Producer. They have enjoyed renting to guests from all over the world for the last 10 years. You will find that the couple is friendly, professional and attentive but also happy to respect your privacy if you prefer less interaction. As they have both lived in the LA area for many years they can also provide any renter with wealth of local information if needed!

name_left: Topanga Gem/ Mountains above Malibu
description:
Architect's Family Home

The space
Looking for a private zen retreat or fun family adventure? This may be the best deal for a full size home on the mountain. Part of the reason is that we only rent when we go away, and our pets stay at the house. So if you are willing to daily feed and take care of 2 indoor cats and a dog, this is a great deal for a lovely space in the middle of Santa Monica Mountains. 10 min. to the beach and Malibu, 15 min. to Santa Monica. Our home has a stunning deck facing the mountains, fireplace, wi-fi, 2 bd, (main bedroom with king, and other with single bed), 2 baths, a fun little loft, plus a convertible queen couch that sleeps 2 in living room. (1300 sq. ft. plus two large decks) Our backyard and side yard is Topanga State Park, and we have direct private trail access for miles and miles of hiking and mountain biking. We are shaded in an oak grove, with large horse pasture and mountain views. Topangan's are just about the most i
host_about:
I am a woman that LOVES where I live.  There isn't a day that goes by that I don't thank God for our sweet home and beautiful and rare surroundings.  My husband, son and I are nature lovers so Topanga is a perfect fit for our healthy, active lifestyles.  We love identifying birds, floral and fauna.  
I am a classical homeopath, nutritionist, life coach and chaplain.  I have a passion for body, mind, spirit healing and holistic living.
The five things I wouldn't want to live without
1.  God
2.  My husband and son
3.  My wonderful extended family
4.  Friends
5.  Healthy lifestyle in nature

name_left: Malibu/Topanga for July
description:
Nestled in the hills between Santa Monica and Malibu this three story house overlooks Topanga State Park. It has eight decks/outdoor seating areas. Renovated in the last year, there are spectacular canyon views throughout the 3300 square foot home and from all 3 acres and extensive park-like grounds.

The space
Just a wonderful place to live. Always felt like a vacation home from the day I moved in. Now it can be your vacation home for the first 2 weeks of August.

Guest access
Free reign throughout the property.
host_about: We live in a canyon in LA and love visiting my old hometown of NY. I miss it quite a bit.  My partner and I met at a party in 1985 in the east village. The "we" consists of my Partner of 32 years and our 2 boys (13 and 17) who are well travelled and well behaved.
