name_left: Rock and Oak Ranch
description:
Overlooking the creek, our rebuilt, modernized yet rustic 3-4 bdrm Topanga home is waiting for you (and your family) to immerse yourselves in the peace of living in nature.

The space
Overlooking the creek, our rebuilt, modernized yet rustic 3-4 bdrm Topanga home is waiting for you (and your family) to immerse yourselves in the peace of living in nature.

Our house is surrounded by two acres yet the mellow neighbors are a stone's throw away across the creek. It feels very private and secure here. It has all the comforts of a modern home in a creekside setting. Very quiet, magical place.

You have access to the entire house including the deck, the lawn, our big trampoline and the beautiful creek (but keep away from the poison oak). You can pick from our fruit trees if you find any ready to eat!

We are happy to stop in and say hello, or not. Entirely up to you. We are committed to your privacy.

Best location in Topanga
neighborhood_overview: Best location in Topanga! One of my favorite things to do is wake in the morning and walk down our windy road to the local french Cafe Mimosa.  Come have a cup of the best coffee, pastries and egg burritos in town.  There are two general stores, and a day spa within 10 minutes walking distance, make reservations in advance, Sienna.)  A short drive (or longer walk) can take you to delicious Italian, French or even romantic favorite Inn of the Seventh Ray for dinner.  Close to fun places to shop and a beautiful new library in the center of town!
host_about: Married couple with two boys.  Brooks is a math teacher and Amy works with animals.  We are easy going and friendly.

name_left: Modern Studio & Micro Farm/Parking Clean&Sanitized
description:
Our studio is a modern space with a comfortable, organic, King size bed, full kitchen, acid stained concrete floors, claw foot bathtub/shower and environmental lighting with dimmers on 1/2 acre of land.
Meticulously clean and sanitized per CDC standards. Self Check-in.
A private deck with BBQ and chaise lounges. Shady, off-street, secure parking. Fresh eggs from our friendly hens and herbs, vegetable and greens from the organic garden.

The space
The Lifekind King size mattress is incredibly comfortable and made with organic cotton, latex and wool. We have 1000 thread count Egyptian cotton linens. Our pillows and duvet are down filled.
(If you need synthetic pillows or duvet we will gladly change them out for you)

Environmental, On-Demand hot water heater

Full kitchen with espresso maker, coffee maker, tea kettle, blender, microwave, toaster oven, full sized oven, pots and pans, fridge and gourmet essentials.
Complime
neighborhood_overview:
We are 6 miles from the beach.
We are 2 miles to the center of Topanga with cafes, restaurants, yoga studio, art galleries, library, 2 general stores and natural food market.
We are 2 miles from Inn Of The Seventh Ray wedding venue and restaurant.

We are on a very quiet street with absolutely no traffic noise. Maybe 5 or 6 cars go by on a given day.

Walk out our front door and you can walk up our street to the dirt roads which lead you to hiking trails, enjoying the views and visiting horses along the way. Our street is a 2 mile loop with incredible views so you can have a great morning run.

Some places to visit are:
Inn of the Seventh Ray Restaurant and wedding venue (2 miles away) creek side dining under the oak trees and fairy lights. Very romantic.

Canyon Bistro Restaurant with outdoor patio (excellent grass fed burgers and sweet potato fries) Vegetarian options. Live music. Call to check their music schedule

Ca
host_about:
My husband, Javier, and I love to travel. Javier is from Madrid and I am a LA native.
 I have lived in Nepal and Thailand, each for a month, London for a year and Japan for almost 4 years working for the Japanese government as an English teacher.  Between us we speak English, French, Spanish and some Japanese. 

I have a BFA in fine art and I started my own business with the money I saved in Japan doing decorative painting in high-end homes: gold leaf, sky ceilings, limewash finishes, frescoes, egg tempera and other decorative finishes. I love to paint, design and draw.

Javier and I are also crazy about Japanese design and we are inspired by the culture, architecture and food. 
Maybe you will feel a Japanese sensibility when you visit?

name_left: Moonfire 60 Acres Film Ranch Beyond
description:
Truly a remarkable property that literally rises above the rest soaring 1,800 feet above the Pacific Crest. Constructed in 1966 for the making of "Harper", starring Paul Newman, Lauren Bacall, and Melanie Griffith. An Andy Warhol favorite as well.

The space
This 60 acre private mountain-top ranch overlooks Los Angeles boasting a true uniqueness with breathtaking 360 degree views. An awesome location for film and production, hosted legends such as Paul Newman, George Harrison, Andy Warhol, and the Doors.

This magnificent property features panoramic views that bring everything into frame from the grand pacific coast line to downtown LA. Truly a remarkable property that literally rises above the rest soaring 1,800 feet above the Pacific Crest. This 60 acre private mountain-top ranch overlooks Los Angeles boasting a true uniqueness with breathtaking 360 degree views. Considered to be known as "The Temple In The Clouds" this property transcends you to a pl

name_left: Beautiful and Peaceful Canyon Home
description:
Restful and relaxing vacation in the heart of Santa Monica Mountains.
5 miles to the Beach, 2-minute walk to the State Park Trails, and tranquil nature all around you.
House is free of EMFs and Chemicals.

The space
Restful and relaxing vacation in the heart of Santa Monica Mountains.
5 miles to the Beach, 2-minute walk to the State Park Trails, and tranquil nature all around you. Wake up to the birds signing, smile at the woodpeckers and squirrels on the branches of an old oak tree in front of the windows... Relax, breath deep and enjoy.

3 bedroom, two bathroom with a large patio, surrounding 75% of the house (bottom floor of the duplex with a private entrance and a yard). Fully furnished.

Little organic garden with vegetables to be harvested (and watered!) in the summer.

For people with EMR sensitivity, WiFi router can be turned off remotely and the house was measured and mitigated for EMFs.

Two designa
neighborhood_overview: It's a quiet family friendly and simply friendly neighborhood.
host_about: I love where I live and am in the state of constant gratitude for the beauty of nature that surrounds me in blessed Topanga - land.

name_left: European Style Casita in Topanga
description:
Cozy and delightful European style detached Casita (tiny house in Spanish) with QUEEN size bed & combined shower/toilet stall. Topanga feels like you're miles away but minutes a part. Close to trails, beaches and wineries. Sunset, Stars and quiet abound.

The space
La Casita means tiny house in Spanish. Very cozy and delightful European style detached bedroom with a shower/toilet combo. A sleeping cottage in the mountains of Old Topanga almost like glamping but with modern conveniences and comfort. WIFI, HD TV, Ultra comfortable QUEENsize bed, hot shower, hot tub, private fire pit and camp kitchen with hot water in the garden for your private use. Winding roads lead you to the top of the Santa Monica Mountains. Feels miles away yet 20 minutes to the beach. The camp kitchen is equipped with fridge, Foreman grill, hot plate, prep table, microwave, Keurig, hot water sink and your private fire pit. Very quiet and in a peaceful neighborhood. Please read FULL Desc
neighborhood_overview:
Winding thru mountain streets you will rise above the canyon floor to a ridge top .The last 500 ft to our house is steep & winding, some are scared at first, but adjust to the roads. Parking is almost always available unless someone is having a party. Look for the wood pile there is usually parking next to it.

The views overlook a huge rock formation called Big Rock. People are friendly yet keep to themselves. Respect & embrace the dark. Topanga is one of the only places in LA where one can see stars. So turn off your lights & help keep light pollution out of the canyon.
host_about: We are from Topanga California though I grew up in Upstate NY. We love Topanga because of the green factor, mountain trails, the eclectic alternative social scene, the quiet and the stars.  We live in the mountains and have 4 adult children. Curtis is a retired LA County Firefighter.  I sell real estate in Topanga.  My motto is "I Never Quit"

name_left: Malibu / Topanga 24 acre Ranch
description:
This Mountain Top Diamond is set in the Santa Monica Mountains over looking Topanga canyon. Spectacular views, resort pool & jacuzzi. Hiking, biking, 30 minutes from almost everything one would like to see in LA. 10 miles from beach.

The space
Where the black top ends! The last Cool, Calm Country Road in the city! The Ranch is close enough but far enough away from the city to make an easy trip for; Shopping ! Warner Center, NEW! Westfield Topanga Village (3rd largest Regional shopping center in the US). Topanga Canyon and Promenade malls all in a 15 min drive. A little farther away you have Rodeo drive, Melrose, Robertson, The Grove, LA's Original Farmers Market, Santa Monica's 3rd st Promenade, all 30-40 min away. Dinner, you have Monty's famous Steak House, Morton's, Flemings & Ruth's Chris to name a few, all 15 min away. Clubs, all of Hollywood is 30minutes away! Museums , Getty, LA Science Center, Natural History, Contemporary Art, Fashion and Industr
neighborhood_overview: We live on the property, are entertainers and welcome new friends, but are not offended by those who prefer to remain alone.
host_about: The Only Limitations Here are those you bring with you!!!

name_left: Malibu at Getty Villa - Ideal for 2
description:
The south wing of the house for your exclusive use. 470 sq feet -Two bedrooms and a bathroom. 2 guest maximum only. The main bedroom has a sea view, the other a tropical garden view. Sunny and airy. The Studio is connected to the house.

The space
We offer 60 Mbs WiFi. Coffee and Tea are available.
No breakfast is served.

PRICING: We can only accomade maximum of 2 guests only. From our experience, more that this does not work well in the space.

Guest access
Guests have their own keyed entrance to the studio through the atrium.

Other things to note
Three fabulous surf breaks are very close by. If you want to try surfing, we can give you all the info regarding hiring boards and wet suits.

There is no kitchen, however, we have a small microwave and also a mini fridge. No TV either.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is called Sunset Mesa and is right at the very start of Malibu. This offers east access to Santa Monica [ about 10 to 30 minutes - depending on traffic!] and about 10 minutes to Malibu Pier and the Malibu Shopping are. This area is a real gem and relatively undiscovered. Practically a gated community with one road in and out with access to the PCH [ Pacific Coast Highway]. Wide streets for easy parking, no unsightly over head wires, great views to the ocean. Very safe for walking day and night and great for young kids. We love the fact that we can walk down the street to the beach in front of the Getty Villa.
We have access cards for the Getty - free entry and you don't have to book ! The Santa Monica mountains abut the back of this small neighborhood and are hikes into the Santa Monica Mountains and Malibu State Park. This is a very tranquil and relaxing neighborhood.

Full high-end sports club/gym located a few blocks away and guests may have access
host_about: We are originally from South Africa and have been living in Los Angeles for 22 years. Silk textile import, Sunbrella outdoor fabric distribution is our business. Artist specializing in Oils depicting Malibu sea scapes and surfing culture. Love to surf and play golf [ happy to play golf or surf with any guests]. Gardening is our passion.

name_left: Beach Canyon Farmhouse with Tipi
description:
Beach Canyon Farmhouse Oasis! Treehouse views from this beautiful Swiss inspired cabin surrounded by authentic, peaceful nature.
Surf, Stand up Paddle, Hike, bike or horseback the ocean view trails ending the day under the stars to wine and cheese in the hot tub or head out to our award winning tipi and sleep under the stars and watch a movie on our huge projector.

The space
Our backyard sits on the entrance to dozens of breathtaking trails, mountain bike tracks and horseback riding trails. Rise and stroll with the sun or challenge yourself to a 5k loop to the sunset while taking in a 180 degree view of the ocean! Get a taste of the rougher life by hiking or horseback riding, or stick to pampering with amenities like yoga, Pilates, and spa treatments in Malibu. (30min drive)

There aren’t many places where you can sleep this comfortably and still see the stars after a wine and cheese in the hot tub evening as the crickets sing you to sleep. We off
neighborhood_overview: We love that Topanga is off the beaten path of the hustle and bustle of traffic and pace of LA, yet minutes to the grocery store and a shell's throw to the beach and Malibu! It's the perfect location to have it all...
host_about:
Hi, we’re the Ammons family. 
We are avid travelers and have 2 kids that we take with us everywhere we go. 
Tate is from Tennessee and Andrea is from Calgary. 
We love adventures and extending the beauty of Topanga to our guests. 
We enjoy hunting for cool items for the house and Tipis and providing little special things for our guests that we also enjoy when we travel. 
We feel so lucky to have the best of all worlds in California- the sand, surf and also the skiing. 
In Topanga, it's off the beaten path with so much peaceful scenery and then so close to the hustle of LA when you want it.

name_left: Charming  2BR/2BA Topanga Home
description:
This knoll top home with canyon views off the front and back reflects my love of original art, travel, and the outdoors. We're unique in our location, privacy and vibe. Unlike a lot of Canyon homes, we get a lot of sunlight, literally from dawn to dusk. Past guests have commented the best time to enjoy the home is at sunset, hanging on the deck, letting the day wind down. We also enjoy being part of a independent minded community that relishes it's relationship with nature and privacy.

The space
Our home is a great space for relaxing in a natural setting and be only 25-40:00 from more urban LA neighborhoods like Santa Monica, Malibu, Venice, Hollywood or DTLA (Downtown LA). We are located at the end of private road so the property and neighborhood is quiet and private. Coyotes and owls are frequent visitors. We are dog friendly but not fenced. There is no car traffic off the property; just frequent passings by of neighbors with their dogs or people on bikes. Th
neighborhood_overview: There is parking out front for one car. You can stack park if there are two cars. Anymore than two cars, please ask me and I'll advise you. To leave the property, which is at the end of a dead end,  please back out and turn around in the second driveway on your right. It's very roomy there and much easier to make the turn. Thanks!
host_about: I landed in Topanga after 14 years of living and working in NYC. Being the giant sprawl that is Los Angeles, I felt incredibly lucky to have found Topanga which is unique in it's connection with nature yet close enough to all the dynamics of a big city. I bought my home in 1996, which was a former hunting cabin and one of the first homes established in the Canyon. I love to travel and my home and property reflects that. I hope you come to love it as much as I do. Welcome!

name_left: ✺ Charming Cottage in the Trees ✺
description:
Unwind and escape in your sunny & rustic hillside Topanga getaway. Enjoy waking up refreshed in a peaceful wooded retreat. This coveted spot will allow you to be surrounded by nature and still in Los Angeles. The bright and spacious cottage feels like a tree house and has plenty of character. The living space is encircled by large windows, filling the space with natural light and the view of trees and mountains.

The space
This peaceful & relaxing space is full of character and is nestled in the Santa Monica Mountains. Enjoy relaxing where the mountains meet the ocean from your private cottage in the trees.

You will have your own totally private cottage. There is one bedroom with a comfortable queen bed, one bathroom with a shower, a cozy daybed, a roomy dining/living area, and a clean and well-lit kitchen. The living/dining area has a sofa with a comfortable fold-out queen bed for additional guests, a TV with Apple TV, and a dining table with seating f
neighborhood_overview:
This charming & cozy cottage is nestled in the lush Santa Monica Mountains in scenic and historic Topanga Canyon. Known as a creative, boheminan enclave close to the city but feeling hours away, Topanga is home to musicians and those who love the outdoors. While you are just minutes away from all Los Angeles has to offer, you feel a world away. Only 1/4 mile to beautiful hiking trails in Topanga State Park. You will feel remote, yet, you are just minutes away from the beach, Malibu, Santa Monica, Calabasas, and Woodland Hills.

Less than a mile to Topanga's restaurants, shops, a fantastic library, yoga studio and the many trails and panoramic views of the Topanga State Park.

Beaches are 5 miles away. Shopping, entertainment and restaurants in Santa Monica and Malibu just a bit further (~20 minutes).
host_about: We are transplants to Topanga and love being in such a rural spot while still in Los Angeles County!

name_left: THE MOUNTAIN MERMAID - Rustic Elegance Rural Bliss
description:
An architectural gem with lush gardens and sweeping mountain views. Beauty, warmth, and serenity are the prime amenities of this bucolic retreat. Built in 1930 as a country club, it went on to become one of Mickey Choen's LA gambling houses, then a gay club, and later the infamous Mermaid Tavern. By the 1980s it was a shipwreck in slow motion with shards of plaster sloughing off like glacier-ice into the sea. Now, fully restored, the Mermaid is ready for you to make some history of your own.

The space
Available for overnight stays through Airbnb. Most filming projects, weddings, memorials, retreats, workshops and events are only booked directly with the owner because they tend to be more complex involving special written agreements and cancellation policies inconsistent with Airbnb .

The $2,500. day rate is for a group of 6 or less staying overnight. Everything else (photoshoots, filming, workshops, retreats, memorials, etc.) is individually priced de
neighborhood_overview: The rural-residential neighborhood has a charming, friendly, laid-back, small-town vibe. Super close to town, yet seems like a world apart. Guest's say they can't believe they're in LA. Five minutes to Topanga center's restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, and post office. Ten minutes to the beach. Ten minutes to Woodland Hills and Ventura Boulevard with every urban amenity. A hiker's paradise. Walk out the door and hike or mountain-bike all the way to Ventura county, West LA, or the ocean over the famous Backbone Trail.
host_about: Long-story-short, I was born in Los Angeles, love art, houses and history, grew weary of working for others as a commercial illustrator, so became my own boss reclaiming and preserving old buildings.

name_left: THE RAINBOW STUDIO - Candy For the Eyes
description:
A visually exciting indoor-outdoor experience! The cavernous studio has 12-foot ceilings that open up on two sides to spacious patios with fountains. Queen-sized bed with Tempurpedic mattress, plus a high-quality sofa-bed. Super-sized kitchen, wi-fi, television, phone, washer and dryer, heating and air conditioning, and off-street parking. Lushly landscaped. 10 minutes to beach, 10 minutes to the city. Surrounded by thousands of acres of parkland.
Sorry, not suitable for parties or pets.

The space
A truly one-of-a kind, insanely colorful space. Artful details and architectural antiques abound. Kitchen has a big pink fridge, green gas range, chartruse coffee-maker, electric tea kettle, toaster, blender, pots, pans, and other basic cooking implements. Bath has shower and private toilet-room. Two closets, dedicated phone line, wifi, and cable television. Immerse yourself inside a hand-painted art-piece created by a life-long visual artist...(that be me).
<
neighborhood_overview: The property is in a wonderful location in Topanga Canyon, just 5 minutes from the Topanga business district's restaurants, coffee shops, and grocery stores. The home is also just 10 minutes to the beach.
host_about: Long-story-short, I was born in Los Angeles, love art, houses and history, grew weary of working for others as a commercial illustrator, so became my own boss reclaiming and preserving old buildings.

name_left: Exquisite Rooms and a Glorious View
description:
Enjoy a spectacular 180 view of Topanga's Saddleback Ridge, a restful night in a suite of two separate bedrooms sleeping up to four decorated with original sculpture and paintings, extra-large private patio under the stars, large custom bathroom, private entrance and complimentary morning coffee and tea service. Please note that we are a smoke-free environment.

The space
Topanga's sun and warm light accentuates these two lovingly decorated bedrooms with original art works from our collection, a large private bathroom, and large private patio. Guests enjoy one bedroom with queen-size bed of luxurious memory foam mattress and a second bedroom with a full-size quality Sealy Pillow-Top mattress; large fully furnished private patio; and bathroom with extra-large shower. double sinks, and skylight. One room includes a 39" HD television and DVD player with choice of hundreds of films from our library, and a mini fridge, wine glasses and bottle opener for your favorit
neighborhood_overview: Our home is situated on five acres so our nearest neighbor is acres away!  There are no street lights in Topanga so the nights are filled with the stars, the rising and setting moon.  Topanga is well know for it's quiet and tranquil beauty.  A perfect getaway for city dwellers that need a break!
host_about: I am an artist and a grantwriting teacher.  My husband Ron and I have lived in Topanga for twenty years.  I enjoy going to museum and galleries and dinner parties with close friends.  I was born in Los Angeles and I know my town very well, but have traveled a great deal internationally and enjoy traveling immensely.   We always enjoy introducing our guests to the beautiful of Topanga Canyon, one of the few rural locations close to the beach in Los Angeles County.

name_left: Magical Artist Beautiful 1 Bedroom Topanga Escape
description:
An artist dreamer or seekers dream space. A beautiful temple created in the canyon. Come create, and enjoy the energy. I am an artist and this home is my temple and I invite you to come be inspired and co-create in my sanctuary. Come for a beautiful stay in a private 1 bedroom apartment in magical Topanga Canyon! A bright and airy ground floor level apartment with your own spacious deck and stunning views. Parking and all basic amenities included, short and long term available.

The space
Please read before booking :)

I would like to start off by mentioning that I have marked this listing as being able to accommodate four guests, based on the idea of two couples coming and sharing the space and one of them being willing to sleep in the living room on the pull out bed and or air mattress. While this space can accommodate four people it is still a one bedroom apartment, and while perfect for 2 guests, 4 can be to close of quarters for some.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is beautiful and quiet… Surrounded by beautiful views, gorgeous trees, and a beautiful little hike right up the street, literally half a block away :) It is green, lush and tranquil up here… A great place for anyone to come and clear their mind or tune into the beautiful setting and energy that Topanga is.

Stunning hikes like the Labyrinth, Topanga State Park and Red Rock are within 10-15 minutes driving.
host_about:
“ Only from the heart can you touch the sky” ~RUMI

Greetings! My name is Alexander, and if fate has it, I hope to be able to share a taste of why people travel from all over the world to Los Angeles, and choose Topanga Canyon as their place to land.   

keep it simple … and above all... keep it real. 

I love supporting causes I believe in and living life to its fullest.  I believe every moment an opportunity to seize our destiny and happiness.  If I had to choose a religion... it would be love. 

Im passionate about finding new and fun creative ways of generating abundance while making a positive difference.  

I’d consider myself an entrepreneur and most of my financial success has been  in Festival/Event Production, Classic Car Restoration and Sales, Management of Cannabis stores and brands and ofcourse landscape design and horticulture which hopefully you will get a chance to see if you come and visit my little slice of heaven. 

I spend most of my free time writing music/poetry, traveling,  gardening and  hunting for treasures.   

I hold integrity, love, compassion and being of service to others as key values that I strive to apply to every moment and situation.

I am grateful for everything that this life and my creator has blessed me with, including the honor of being the guardian of this sacred and special property. It has a way of calling in magical kin and like hearted beings who are seeking respite and a place to let the creative juices flow! 

My favorite place's to travel to are Bali,, Costa Rica, Tulum, Corsica, Hana/Kauai  and France.

I am a writer, an artist, and a creative expressionist of many forms.

Once upon a Time 
Within a rhyme, 
There rested a place, 
A Space and Time,
Where in a space of Void
All Is To Be…
The Expression that is You…
And the Expression that is Me…

In the Emptiness and Void,
In its Darkness and Whole…
We gave birth to a Light 
That has now lost control.
Shifting and growing 
and glowing so bright,
spark of Infinity 
in the Infinite Night.

Growing and Glowing,
Expanding with Knowing
Breathing and Living
Moving and Flowing,
Silent and Still,
Eternal and Whole,
Infinitely Empty, and Eternally Full.

As you Grow in your Light, in this Infinite Night,
Shining so radiantly White and so Bright,
Your Mother, the Darkness, the Earth and her Womb, 
Has Offered her Emptiness as your Life and your Tomb,
The Gift of this Life and the Gift of our Death.
The Contraction and Expansion of Breath.

And in the Gift of Challenge,
Times I thought to much to bear,
I discovered there was a Gift, 
that which I would like to Share,
For it is the gift of becoming strong 
And cultivating Gifts for you to Give,
Empowering you to heal others,
As you are Blessed in how you Live.

Grounded in your Presence,
Connected and Divinely Aware.
Of the stories that we Create,
Within the Stories that we Bear…
Guided by our Hearts,
Our Minds become the Tool,
to Uncover and Discover 
Limitless Jewels...
Within and all around Us.

May you always remember to live without fear.
For our physical Death will always be near.
May this be the Gift that allows you to see...
The Present of the Moment, that is You, and is Me.
And in the Presence of this Moment, 
Please know I took the Time, 
to share with you this rhyme, 
because I Love You…

It is Fear that Separates us and makes Life hard to live,
You must always remember to Love and to Give, 
to forgive and to love, for there’s so much Love… 
and this is why, the reason at hand, 
that I share with You this Gift that's so grand.
To do what you Love, To Be True to You,
To do things that honor You,
In all that You Do!

To give is to Live 
is to Love 
is to Be….
So abundantly full and yet so empty and free…
To love… 
this is to live… 
and so I love you.

The Wish I Wish to Give You is the Gift of Love for You….
Please forgive me…I forgive you . Thank You....I love you. 

~AMW

name_left: Magical Topanga Creative Temple
description:
I am artist and creative and this is my Creative Temple and Sanctuary.
The space is created to inspire artistic creative vibes and is universally spiritually set for open minded reflection and spiritual introspection.
This beautiful 2 bedroom (master bedroom + open air loft second room) is the perfect getaway in the famous Topanga Canyons. Complete with hardwood floors, a fire place, and stunning views on an acre of lush land. Surrounded by nature and hiking trails, check in, tune in & unwind.

The space
A constantly evolving space, home to The largest nature alter being created in LA. Created to inspire nurture and dive deep. Star lights and salt lamps, spiritual books and art and music supplies the perfect place to create, meditate, or spend time with someone special . The space is always improving you are welcome to contribute as long as it is a addition. Designed to inspire to allow creative and meditative states to be reached easily.
neighborhood_overview: A quiet and peaceful neighborhood.  The occasional dog walker or hiker.  Friendly neighbors who respect people privacy.  Beautiful trees and green everywhere.  The drive up to the house itself is one of the most beautiful drives in town.

My favorite place's to travel to are Bali,, Costa Rica, Tulum, Corsica, Hana/Kauai  and France.

I am a writer, an artist, and a creative expressionist of many forms.

Once upon a Time 
Within a rhyme, 
There rested a place, 
A Space and Time,
Where in a space of Void
All Is To Be…
The Expression that is You…
And the Expression that is Me…

In the Emptiness and Void,
In its Darkness and Whole…
We gave birth to a Light 
That has now lost control.
Shifting and growing 
and glowing so bright,
spark of Infinity 
in the Infinite Night.

Growing and Glowing,
Expanding with Knowing
Breathing and Living
Moving and Flowing,
Silent and Still,
Eternal and Whole,
Infinitely Empty, and Eternally Full.

As you Grow in your Light, in this Infinite Night,
Shining so radiantly White and so Bright,
Your Mother, the Darkness, the Earth and her Womb, 
Has Offered her Emptiness as your Life and your Tomb,
The Gift of this Life and the Gift of our Death.
The Contraction and Expansion of Breath.

And in the Gift of Challenge,
Times I thought to much to bear,
I discovered there was a Gift, 
that which I would like to Share,
For it is the gift of becoming strong 
And cultivating Gifts for you to Give,
Empowering you to heal others,
As you are Blessed in how you Live.

Grounded in your Presence,
Connected and Divinely Aware.
Of the stories that we Create,
Within the Stories that we Bear…
Guided by our Hearts,
Our Minds become the Tool,
to Uncover and Discover 
Limitless Jewels...
Within and all around Us.

May you always remember to live without fear.
For our physical Death will always be near.
May this be the Gift that allows you to see...
The Present of the Moment, that is You, and is Me.
And in the Presence of this Moment, 
Please know I took the Time, 
to share with you this rhyme, 
because I Love You…

It is Fear that Separates us and makes Life hard to live,
You must always remember to Love and to Give, 
to forgive and to love, for there’s so much Love… 
and this is why, the reason at hand, 
that I share with You this Gift that's so grand.
To do what you Love, To Be True to You,
To do things that honor You,
In all that You Do!

To give is to Live 
is to Love 
is to Be….
So abundantly full and yet so empty and free…
To love… 
this is to live… 
and so I love you.

The Wish I Wish to Give You is the Gift of Love for You….
Please forgive me…I forgive you . Thank You....I love you. 

~AMW

name_left: Topanga View Private Cottage
description:
French doors invite you to a charming flowered garden with a stunning mountain vista. Dappled sunlight plays across the wooden floors of the comfortable and relaxing 12 foot high living space. 10 minutes to the beach or the Valley.

The space
A fantastic location only 8 mins to the San fernando Valley, 10 mins to the Beach, 20 mins from Santa Monica, 40 Mins from LAX. You can hike stunning mountain trails in the morning and relax at the beach all afternoon. Our beautiful free standing cottage guesthouse features French doors leading to private yard and a garden with sun loungers and deck chairs to enjoy the sunshine and the mountain views. Sunlight fills the 12 foot high living space downstairs with a cheerful atmosphere. There is a well appointed kitchen and a cozy loft bedroom. The couch and love seat both fold out into a comfy sleepers. Surrounded by parklands perfect for hiking and biking, enjoy the feel of a private home and garden, not a sterile hotel room.
neighborhood_overview: Topanga unique with its mellow, small town country feel so close to the City. The Canyon is surrounded by parkland and beautiful mountains, yet only minutes to the beaches and urban attractions. A quick trip to the Valley provides access to freeways that will get you to Los Angeles' many tourist attractions.  Hop onto the 101 freeway to Universal Studios, Hollywood, and other tourist attractions Los Angeles has to offer. Topanga connects the Valley to the Ocean.  Even the snowy slopes are only 75 minutes away in the snow season.
host_about:
We have lived in this wonderful village for 30 years.  Topanga is a fascinating place to visit, perfectly situated in LA and full of its own charming attractions.  Ken is a composer in the film and TV world  and  record producer.I am a veterinary nurse--we both love animals and Topanga is a great place for both domestic and wild animals, hiking, getting to the beach or as a home base for all LA site seeing.  Our guest house is truly comfortable , sunny and well appointed with a large private garden space fur sunning, eating or just lazing about.  We can help point you in fun directions and even help you get there, or be completely invisible.  We look forward to 
making our guest house a resource for a wonderful vacation for you.

neighborhood_overview:
Southern California has many activities suiting a variety of lifestyles. Topanga Canyon is a jewel that sits between and shares the unparallelled beauty of Malibu and The Pacific Palisades. It is a small, friendly art focused community which thankfully most don't know about it. It is one of the reasons the canyon is still pristine, even amongst one of the largest cities in the world. This is your opportunity to discover one of the best kept secrets in all of Los Angeles...

Our home is perfect for a variety of uses.
- Small families looking for a wonderful way to connect with the natural surroundings of Topanga State Park, and to easily access many activities including hiking, biking, horseback riding, surfing, etc. Or to use as a base heading to Southern California's theme parks, shopping in places like Santa Monica, The Santa Monica Pier, riding bikes on the Boardwalk in Venice, or a variety of other venues and events...

name_left: Light Filled Bohemian Haven with Hot Tub and Mountain Views
description: Relax on the expansive decks of this bright airy rustic modern home nestled on an acre of land in the Santa Monica Mountains. Embrace the blend of style and nature in this plant filled retreat featuring wood finishes, a private sauna, and canyon views. A large vinyl collection, a game closet, and a plethora of books will keep you entertained. A path looping throughout the ancient oak and native plant covered property makes for lovely meandering walks with great hiking and beaches nearby. Listen to the hooting of owls as you soak in the hot tub under the stars to finish off a perfect day.
neighborhood_overview: Topanga Canyon is known as a bohemian enclave attracting artists, musicians, and filmmakers. Close to greater Los Angeles yet worlds away from the hustle and bustle, a slower paced life is found. About two miles from the center of Topanga and ten minutes from the beach, the house is surrounded by anient oaks, perched above a seasonal creek, and looks out over beautiful views of the surrounding hills from every room. There is fabulous hiking, with miles of trails in nearby Topanga State Park.
host_about: A bohemian mother of two from Topanga, California who runs an Eco clothing company and loves to travel, hike, vintage shop, read, and hang out with friends and family.

neighborhood_overview:
Topanga is known as a bohemian enclave, with roots going back to the hippie movement of the 1960’s. Its’ unique character has attracted artists of all kinds, many of which still live here today. Topanga is also famous for its music scene, and is home to musicians such as Colin Hay, Mick Fleetwood, and Alice Cooper.

Numerous festivals and events are organized in the canyon every year, including the Topanga Days Festival and Topanga Earth Day. Additionally, The Topanga Film Institute hosts the annual Topanga Film Festival which features films from all over the world

Our neighborhood is safe and quiet while being close to everything LA County has to offer. We’re minutes away from world renowned surfing in Malibu and shopping in Santa Monica. There’s fabulous hiking right out of the door and miles of trails in our very own 10,000 acre Topanga State Park. This park is locally renowned for its beauty, and is one of the largest open space preserves surrounded by a city
host_about:
I am a fashion designer with my own label and lines, designing for luxury boutiques and catalogs. I am a workaholic and I travel extensively for my work. I am also a single mom and spend as much time as possible with my son who is my life. I love living in Topanga/Malibu in the mountains with the ocean so close by. There is a very creative energy at the house and all my new work is created there. I get inspired by the colors of nature and the incredible sunsets.
I hope that you get the peace, quiet and the healing from my special piece of the mountain.

By day, enjoy views of birds bathing at
neighborhood_overview:
Our little neighborhood is friendly, safe and quiet. It is also very convenient for whatever you want to do.

The beach is a gorgeous 15 minute drive through historical Topanga Canyon.

Topanga Canyon (10 mins through the mountains) is an adorable little mountain town chock full of creative folks, with eclectic cafes, restaurants, galleries, gift shops, hiking, and general mountain exploration and drives.

Calabasas is the next town over and just 5 minutes up Mulholland Drive to Old Town Calabasas, shops, and the awesome Saturday morning Farmer's Market.

We are also five minutes from the 101, the fabulous new outdoor mall The Village, the Topanga Mall, Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, Sprouts, a myriad of restaurants and cafes & several gyms.

LA, Hollywood, Studio City, Santa Monica, Venice Beach: Anywhere into the city is generally about a 45 minute drive (give our take for traffic etc.). Whenever you can we recommend taking the scen
host_about:
I am an artist and art therapist and I designed my house and grounds with hosting in mind. Sunshine, our sweet, gentle, house cat, and I love to welcome guests into this creative space and share our lovely spot, gorgeous views and healing mountain retreat with fellow travelers and explorers. 

When I'm home I like to give my guests their space while also welcoming conversation when desired. During your stay I am available for counseling and creative journaling sessions and can provide personal tours of our fabulous canyons, beaches, towns and tourist spots with a local's insider knowledge. 

When I am away enjoy the whole house as if it were your own. This home is a very special healing space where you can unwind on the large deck relaxing on the chaise or rocking in the hammock, reading, birdwatching, enjoying the views and napping. All manner of creative tools and toys are on hand if you get inspired to make some art of your own. Yoga mat, blocks, stretch bands, and other exercise tools are on hand for your use as well. 

The house also has all the amenities to get some work done while still feeling like you're on vacation with plenty of space on our two decks and three patios to spread out and find your perfect spot to work, meditate, play, converse, do yoga, and relax. 

There is also a pool and a community center with ping pong and pool tables a short walk up our little street. I'm sure you will love our quiet little community and the convenience of this area to beaches, canyons, mountain hikes and the bustle and excitement of Los Angeles. And when you get back home from your adventures our resident energy healer Sunshine the cat is on hand to soothe and warm your spirit with her gentle energy.

May your real life surpass your wildest dreams.  -Kaalomai

The soul is here for it's own joy.  
-Rumi

name_left: ★Treehouse Tranquility★Escape to Serenity★Views★
description:
Looking to get away from it all?

SoCal locals love my cozy refuge for just that reason. Your own private retreat close to beaches. Come for just one night if that's all you can spare.

De-stress in my secluded mountain view sanctuary with a mighty little kitchenette for take-out or make your own meals.

Flexibility of self check-in; disinfectant wiped-down surfaces; practicing social distancing yet I'm just a text or call away.

Come experience the romance of my stylish, nurturing nest!

The space
Located in the climate perfect Fernwood area of Topanga, the pristine guest suite is just a 2 minute drive (up my paved and winding street that can be a little steep in spots) off Topanga Canyon Boulevard (but worlds away) and part of my cottage home with its own private entrance. Tranquil sea breezes, mountain and canyon views abound. 8 minutes to the beach. 15 minutes to Malibu. 15-20 minutes to Santa Monica or Woodland H
neighborhood_overview: I've prepared a Guest Welcome Kit notebook in the studio with the 411 on Topanga (and surrounding areas) with suggestions for everything from Topanga’s restaurant offerings to hiking trails or where to shop for vintage clothing.  Plus wine tastings and beaches.  Whether it's the 60s throwback Inn of the Seventh Ray or yoga classes at Yoga Desa, you'll find Topanga to be a refreshing escape from urban life.
host_about:
I’m an energetic entrepreneur and love anything to do with beautiful design, nurturing small spaces, Windstar Cruises, laughter, metaphysics, throwing intimate dinner parties and a particular 1998 BMW roadster with over 369k miles on it.  Really. 

I have degrees in Home Economics---wait til you taste my home-made gluten free chocolate chip cookies! And, I’ve recently retired from running my own spokesperson business since I was a child.

Originally from the midwest (Wisconsin, Ohio, Indiana), I started my career in NYC and moved to LA in the early 90s. I returned to Topanga Canyon after an 11 year stint in Santa Fe, NM where I remodeled my home in the Galisteo basin to be an eco-friendly luxury retreat from the chaos of modern civilization.  I cherished my time there, but I missed the Mediterranean climate and beauty of Topanga Canyon.  I hope you enjoy my bucolic getaway as much as I do!

Welcome to Topanga!

neighborhood_overview:
Topanga is a haven for artists, musicians, film industry professionals and nature lovers. Topanga is an unincorporated area in western Los Angeles County, California, USA. It is located in the Santa Monica Mountains. Occupying Topanga Canyon, it is often referred to by that name. Topanga is 12,748 acres (52 km2) in size, and is bounded on three sides by State Park or conservancy lands, and on the south by the Pacific Ocean and a small strip of Malibu, which is the main community to the west. On the east is Pacific Palisades. Topanga has a population of 5,441 as of 2000.

Topanga is the name given to the area by the Tongva tribe, and may mean "a place above." It was the western border of their territory, abutting the Chumash tribe that occupied the coast from Malibu northwards. Bedrock mortars can be found carved into rock outcroppings in many locations.

Topanga was first settled in 1839. Among the first settlers were the Trujillo and Cheney families.

In

description:
Your very own Private Cabin on Gated Property, next to wilderness, with hundreds of miles of fire roads, mountain bike and hiking trails in clean open air to refresh your spirit for a day trip or location. Skylights above a queen bed and a beautiful tile mosaic are just two of the many things that make this such a unique retreat. Please ask, obvious questions are welcome

The space
The Guest Cabin is your perfect escape from urban confusion and the stress of social distancing with all amenities for a perfect getaway! We use CDC safe guidelines for cleaning your private shower, kitchenette and bathroom as well as a queen bed with fresh sheets under star gazer's skylights, WiFi so you can work! Only 22 miles from down town Los Angeles it feels like 100 miles from civilization. 15 minutes drive to the beach, 30 minutes to Santa Monica. We have over 70 live oaks on the property to filter the perfect air. So far from the roar of civilization you will think you are i
neighborhood_overview: We are off of a private road in a wilder part of Topanga. The neighbors are friendly but stay to themselves. Come armed with a smile is all you need. It is a short drive to Red Rock Canyon Park, or if you are fit you can hike 8 mile ridge loop that takes you around the canyon rim before it drops into Red Rock Canyon Park then back up to the cabin on Topanga Skyline Drive.
host_about:
I am a 30 year veteran of the Adventure Sports/Commercial Television and Film World.  I grew up between the Mountains of Colorado, in Vail and Aspen, and a large cattle ranch in Northwest Montana.  After a year of school at Prescott College in Arizona and several more shooting ski films in Colorado, I moved to North Hollywood where I lasted about 6 months before fleeing to Half Moon Bay.  I eventually made it back to Hollywood because of "The Business" and for about 5 years lived on my sailboat.  Throughout this time I was traveling the world shooting films and first kayak descents of rivers and ski descents of mountains.  About 10 years ago I met my sweetheart at the Premier of an IMAX Film called "Mystery of the Nile" we shot while making the first "Source to Sea" descent of the Nile.  After a couple of years living in the Marina we decided to settle in Topanga with our young family.  As luck would have it, we found a magical piece of property, with direct access to over 100 miles of hiking/mountain biking trails through Topanga State Park and adjacent wild areas, while being only 22 miles direct from downtown Los Angeles.  Now I am able to work closer to home and family.  Airbnb along with some beautiful property with stunning views is helping fulfill that dream....
As far as hosting, I would personally like to make everyone who stays with us a lifelong friend but I am also just happy to share a such a beautiful place so close to the city, yet so far away from all the noise and haste!  
If you decide to stay with us, you are welcome to request additional services like breakfast, cappuccino or a shuttle to the airport, direction and information on local resources.  We will do what we can to make sure our guests have a wonderful stay in a truly magical place with no worries about the small stuff.

neighborhood_overview:
Topanga is surrounded by Topanga State Park, the largest wilderness area located within a city limit in the United States.

Topanga is home to a large population of native species of plants, trees, birds, and animals - most prominently red tail hawks ( which favor several of the trees near the house), coyotes, mountain lions, bobcats, owls, lizards, snakes, native live oaks. We live in the midst of an unspoiled natural environment. Topanga was recently certified as a Wildlife Habitat by The National Wildlife Federation.

Hiking is a major outdoor activity. There are also some areas for recreational biking - you will have to sort that out yourself - there is always music at several restaurants and small venues. There are a number of Yoga and Pilates studios.

The Topanga community is know as a haven for artists, musicians, actors, filmakers, and is host to a variety of festivals throughout the year. There are The Topanga Days Parade and Country Fair, The 4
host_about:
I am an artist/designer, color consultant, and father. 
My wife and I purchased this property in beautiful Topanga in 2015. We are both artists, our studios are on the premises, It is a blessing to live and work here in the canyon. I enjoy restoring and collecting antiques and modernist collectibles, hiking, and music. It's an amazing place to raise a kid and create.

The space
Get away from it all at this serene estate. Your new home is situated in a quiet, gated and guarded community tucked away within the Santa Monica Mountains. Of course, if you ever need anything, you’re only seven minutes up the hill fr
neighborhood_overview:
In gorgeous serene quiet Topanga Canyon set in the Santa Monica Mountains nestled between the ocean and San Fernando Valley is my beautiful estate home. We are close to the beaches, a grocery store, and plenty of activities and restaurants.

You will find hiking paths and bike trails only a few minute walk away. At night, you can see the stars while hearing the crickets chirp in the background after dark. The mountain breezes are incredible. The resort-style backyard has a BBQ, a walk-in pool, tables with seating for 12 provides. It is perfect for hanging out, studying, or escaping city life.

The space

neighborhood_overview:
Our little neighborhood is friendly, safe and quiet. It is also very convenient for whatever you want to do.

The beach is a gorgeous 15-20 minute drive through historical Topanga Canyon.

Topanga Canyon (10-15 mins through the mountains) is an adorable little mountain town chock full of creative folks, with eclectic cafes, restaurants, galleries, gift shops, hiking, and general mountain exploration and drives.

Calabasas is the next town over and just 10 minutes up Mulholland Drive to Old Town Calabasas, shops, and the awesome Saturday morning Farmer's Market.

We are also five minutes from the 101,
the fabulous Topanga Mall, The Village Open Air Mall, Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, Sprouts, a myriad of restaurants and cafes & several gyms.

We are about 45 minutes from LA, Hollywood, Santa Monica and Venice Beach depending on traffic.

Whenever you can we recommend taking the scenic drive through Topanga Canyon and along
host_about:
I am an artist and art therapist and I designed my house and grounds with hosting in mind. Sunshine, our sweet, gentle, house cat, and I love to welcome guests into this creative space and share our lovely spot, gorgeous views and healing mountain retreat with fellow travelers and explorers. 

When I'm home I like to give my guests their space while also welcoming conversation when desired. During your stay I am available for counseling and creative journaling sessions and can provide personal tours of our fabulous canyons, beaches, towns and tourist spots with a local's insider knowledge. 

When I am away enjoy the whole house as if it were your own. This home is a very special healing space where you can unwind on the large deck relaxing on the chaise or rocking in the hammock, reading, birdwatching, enjoying the views and napping. All manner of creative tools and toys are on hand if you get inspired to make some art of your own. Yoga mat, blocks, stretch bands, and other exercise tools are on hand for your use as well. 

The house also has all the amenities to get some work done while still feeling like you're on vacation with plenty of space on our two decks and three patios to spread out and find your perfect spot to work, meditate, play, converse, do yoga, and relax. 

There is also a pool and a community center with ping pong and pool tables a short walk up our little street. I'm sure you will love our quiet little community and the convenience of this area to beaches, canyons, mountain hikes and the bustle and excitement of Los Angeles. And when you get back home from your adventures our resident energy healer Sunshine the cat is on hand to soothe and warm your spirit with her gentle energy.

May your real life surpass your wildest dreams.  -Kaalomai

The soul is here for it's own joy.  
-Rumi

Adorable, intimate, cottage built in 1930 with uber-romantic tower bedroom to die for, full kitchen, two bathrooms, and wifi. Located in the heart of Topanga, the legendary hippy citadel of love, and surrounded by 243 square miles of the breathtaking Santa Monica Mountains, world's largest urban park. Sleeps 3 with a queen in the tower and a daybed downstairs. Huge 2 person tub, wifi, yard, three fountains, lush landscaping, birds and butterflies. Sorry, not suitable for parties or pets.

The space
Stand-alone cottage/bungalow, filled with romance to the max. Charming, warm, private, and drop-dead-gorgeous. The oversized, two-person tub in the candle-lit room dedicated to the art of taking a bath, with a wall of glass doors that open to the outdoors. A second tub has a shower. Two private toilet rooms. Upstairs is arguably one of the sweetest bedrooms in all of Los Angeles. The perfect couple get-away place...or solo retreat.
Very roomy outside with lush tr
neighborhood_overview: The rural-residential neighborhood has a charming, friendly, laid-back, small-town vibe. Super close to town, yet seems like a world apart. Guest's say they can't believe they're in LA. Five minutes to Topanga center's restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, and post office. Ten minutes to the beach. Ten minutes to Woodland Hills and Ventura Boulevard with every urban amenity. A hiker's paradise. Walk out the door and hike or mountain-bike all the way to Ventura county, West LA, or the ocean over the famous Backbone Trail.

name_left: Treetop Oasis with a Balcony and Mountain Views
description:
This guest suite blends vintage furniture and artwork with a 70's-inspired decor. Original wood-paneled walls and countless potted plants complement the gorgeous mountain views and wildlife that can be seen from the windows and private balcony.

NOTE: This guest suite is below our main house, but feels very private. It overlooks our neighbors horses, so you may hear occasional neighing.

The kitchen has almost everything, except a full size oven. However, it is large enough to cook a small pizza or make a batch of cookies. Our garden is always filled with herbs you can enjoy!
neighborhood_overview:
A gentle ocean breeze provides a pleasant climate in the neighborhood where secret walking trails take you through the lush scenery. Go for a hike and a picnic in the morning and then head to the shimmering local beach just 15 minutes away.

We are in the hilly part of the canyon, which means the best views, but also some narrow steep roads. I recommend a smaller car if possible or taking it slow and enjoying the sounds of nature!
host_about:
I live in Topanga Canyon with my husband and my two little dogs, surrounded by nature. I love gardening, cooking, exploring different parts of LA and trying new restaurants, lazing at the beach, and most of all, I love animals and helping them in anyway possible. We often have one or two foster dogs at home. 

I try to travel as much as possible and enjoy staying at Airbnbs so I can meet locals and learn the secret spots! We recently decided to open up our home as an Airbnb host. We have two unique spaces, both filled with plants and surrounded by nature. We love nature and strive to reduce our impact when creating these spaces, so most of the items are sourced second hand from the 70's and 80's.

We are excited to meet new people and help make their time here as fun and relaxing as possible!

The space
There are 3 parking spaces in front of the property and more on the street nearby.

Guest access
Gated property.

Other things to note
Our home is a lovely retreat for your relaxation. We ask our guests to be courteous to our neighbors and respect quiet relaxing zones keeping outdoor noise levels to a minimum.

Complete manual with instructions of all electronic comforts of the house and local area information on restaurant and places of interest available in the house.
neighborhood_overview:
Scenic, Elegant, stylish, comfortable and peaceful house sitting privately on over an acre of sprawling grass overlooking 360 degree views; all within walking distance to shops, restaurants and many scenic hikes; close to beaches and one of the most amazing cities in the world.
Amazing kitchen and dining, generous bedrooms and living space as well as many outdoor sitting areas, pool, table tennis, hammocks, fruit trees, terraced hillsides and much more.

The property manager lives next door and is here to help should you have any questions, concerns, or special requests.
There are three on site parking spaces during your stay and there is plenty of street parking for any visitors.

We prefer no smoking on the property.
In consideration of our neighbors, we ask that all outdoor noise to end before 10:30 pm on weekends and 9 pm on weekdays.

name_left: Do Drop In - walk to town, entire house in Topanga
description:
In Topanga, where the mountains meet the sea, you'll find a bright, private, well-lighted two-bed, two-bath home nestled in the live oak. Our space is the perfect place to tune in, turn on, and drop out into this thriving community and its slow, creative vibe.

The space
Originally built in 1949, our spacious, rustic house offers a warm and comfortable respite from the bustle of a busy day in the City of Angels or after a sun-drenched day at the beach. Of the two bedrooms, one is quite large and furnished with two twin beds that can be configured to meet your needs, such as creating a large king size bed. Additional beds, such as air mattresses, can be added. The second room comes with a queen bed and is dark and quiet and ideal for sleeping.
The living room has a double size futon couch that lowers into a bed.
Although our house comfortably sleeps 5, there can be room for up to 8 guests on a shorter stay with air beds added to the larger room. The sho
neighborhood_overview:
1/10 of a mile to Topanga State Park, 4.5 miles to Topanga State Beach, 15 minutes to the surf Mecca of Malibu or to Santa Monica, 24 miles to Hollywood
Experience life as a Topangan through our live music, film festivals, farmers' market, yoga, Shakespeare at the world famous Theatricum Botanicum, extensive hiking trails.
We are conveniently located in the center of Topanga,  just off Topanga Canyon Blvd. Five local restaurants are within walking distance as is Topanga State Park, where miles of  hiking and biking trails will keep you occupied for days.
The town center, known as Pine Tree Circle, includes a variety of small, privately owned shops, including a gourmet store, yoga studio, and general market.
Activities beyond hiking and biking include dance (Middle Eastern, West African, Three Rhythms, Flamenco) horseback riding, yoga, and Tae Kwon Do.
Night life includes live jazz at the Canyon Bistro, Shakespeare under the stars at the Theatricum Botanicum, an
host_about:
Hi I'm Sue.  While vacationing with my family  I like meeting new people and experiencing new places.   I especially like road trips.  And it turns out I love California.   I can officially call it home. 
As hosts, my husband and I enjoy showing guests around and sharing our favorite things about the Los Angeles area, such as, hiking in the local mountains, swimming in the ocean, going to yoga classes and dancing to live music.  Some of our favorite sites to visit in Los Angeles are Olvera Street, the Santa Monica Pier ferris wheel, the Griffith Observatory and the Getty Center. 
We aren't originally from California and camping has been one of our favorite ways to explore the state.  When camping we make it a habit to visit the local laundromats and meet the local people.  Our profile photo is from when we were dating almost 20 years ago.  We are the proud parents of two teenagers, who we have raised in the loving and supportive community of Topanga Canyon.

name_left: Canyon Romance at the "Birdhouse".
description:
The "Birdhouse" was built as a guest cottage for the main house in 1923. It’s located at the rear of the property and has been a romantic getaway for couples and artist for decades. Located in Topanga, CA. This charming one of a kind cottage features a stunning bedroom with walls of glass, a cozy living area, work and eating area, “kitchenette” stocked with all your basic cooking needs.
A wraparound deck gives you 360' views of the adjacent State Park, comfy outside seating to dine or stargaze.

The space
The birdhouse decor is artistic, very romantic, that perfectly blends with its rustic beauty and history found in each room. Starting from the moment enter and see the salvage pier post which came from the Santa Monica Pier Fire in the early 1900’s.

The Birdhouse house with all its rustic charm also has all of today’s modern needs and convenience. WiFi, fire stick T.V etc.”


The property backs 285 acres of beautiful state park,
neighborhood_overview: Topanga... There is  no other place like it in the world. Whether you're coming in from out of the country or for a escape from the city. The Birdhouse is calling you. Perfect location with easy access to everything you need.
host_about: I'm an Author and enjoy my family and friends. Life is good! For more information about me you can visit my website or find me on (Website hidden by Airbnb)

name_left: Oak Forest Retreat
description:
Topanga is a small village that is not very densely populated, quiet & clean. A good place to be during these times. My place is in an oak forest in the mountains close to Topanga State Park.
We are surrounded by beautiful nature & quiet outdoor space.
Only 10 min to the beach and 20 min to Santa Monica/Venice or Woodland Hills. The town center with restaurants, shops and our library are 2 min away. It's good for couples & singles.
Families + kids message me with details before booking.

The space
The house is nestled among oak trees in scenic and historic Topanga Canyon. You will be in the 700+ sqft downstairs of the house. I live upstairs in an attached part of the house. Not above the AirBnb space. My AirBnb space is private and I have my own entrance to my space. There are two moderate sized bedrooms, with one queen and one California king bed, both with pleasant views and plenty of light. There is one bathroom, a roomy dining/living area, an
neighborhood_overview: I've lived in Topanga Canyon for 30 years and can truly call it home! The breathtaking natural beauty here and its unique people keep me in love with this place. The people are interesting and there still is some bohemian culture to be found. I hike almost everyday and can share some good trails. We are in a very quiet neighborhood close to Topanga State Park where you can hike and enjoy the natural beauty here. The photos on the listing were all taken by me in the neighborhood.
host_about:
I'm a Film/TV composer, photographer and world traveler. I've lived in Topanga Canyon for over 30 years and can truly call it home!  The breathtaking natural beauty and its unique people keep me in love with this place. The people are interesting and there still is some bohemian culture to be found. I hike almost every day and can share some good trails. 

My place is a reflection of my life. I lived in Asia for years and the house has an zen, craftsman feel. I've also traveled to many other countries. My photography is around the house, as well as music related art, animation cells ( I wrote music for Rugrats, Catdog, Recess,etc..), and ethnic art I have collected on my travels. 

My house is very peaceful and meditative. We are in a very quiet neighborhood close to Topanga State Park where you can hike. We are also close to the town village. I have a cat but she does not live in the part of the house I have for Airbnb. I've posted some of my photos of the natural beauty here in Topanga Canyon. Welcome!!

name_left: The Topanga Retreat has the best view in Topanga!!
description:
The unit is safe and sanitary, and provides a safe haven during these trying times, and is close to the beach. The views shown in the photos are actual views from the unit. This private suite is reached by romantic set of sweeping stairs fabricated with Canyon rock. The private pathway and balcony are automatically lit at night. The newly remodeled suite is completely separate from the other part of the home. It features 5 star amenities, and offers a 180 degree panorama of the Topanga canyon.

The space
All of our ratings are 5 star ratings! The suite is a modern unit that has a full bath, with a kitchenette, providing a microwave, a Keurig coffee maker, an induction cooking system, a refrigerator, and a toaster. The bed is top class and the Hi Definition TV provides Netflix and Amazon Prime free, as well as providing access to your own subscriptions like Netflix, HBO, ect. There is a split-leaf dinette table in the unit and a glass and iron dinette table on yo
neighborhood_overview:
The Topanga Retreat is located in an ideal country setting providing sweeping views of the rustic canyon leading up from the beach. The abundance of native plants and trees, including Coastal Redwoods and Oak Trees, numerous species of wildlife, like the native Racoons, soaring Red Tailed Hawks, hooting Owls, Red-Headed Woodpeckers, and howling Coyotes combine to form an enchanted place of rest and relaxation.

The hiking trails are truly magnificent and can also be used for mountain biking and horseback riding.

Topanga Park

For all of you who don't know, the Topanga Park is located adjacent to the community of Topanga, within the City of Los Angeles. Covering 11,000 acres, with thirty-six miles of trails and unimproved roads, the park's boundaries stretch from Topanga Canyon to Pacific Palisades and Mulholland Drive. There are more than 60 trail entrances with the largest being located in Topanga. Topanga State Park is not only the largest park in th
host_about:
I am presently a writer. I recently wrote the Malibu-Topanga Guidebook,  which will be available on Amazon for auto-format viewing on many venues including cell phones, iPads, Tablets, Ebook Readers, Laptops, PCs and Smart TVs. I also completed a book on fiction set in Mallorca, Spain and spanning a time line from WWII through the cold war of the early sixties. It is called the Island of Salt ad Tears. The book just came back from editing, which I am hard pressed to plow through.  In addition, I just completely revised a law book on tenant's rights that I wrote over twenty years ago. To add to my workload, I am completing the final read-through on a book about surfing and the crazy dog that accompanied me on most of my surfing excursions and mishaps. It is a little like "On The Road" by Jack Kerouac, with a cast of nutty characters to give anyone a chuckle. Finally, I started on new book tentatively called the Scion of the Sword, which I have plotted out to the end (which is a joke because books tend to write themselves once the journey begins). 

I love cooking, good restaurants, and Italian cuisine. I am a avid skier, cyclist (mountain and road), hiker and surfer. I paint canvas with oils and sketch on anything. I love Pickwick's Pub where I can raise a Bass, talk to my mates , and enjoy fish and chips without remorse. 

I like the music of Pink Floyd, Led Zeppelin, Likin Park, Leonard Cohen, John Lennon, Verdi, Puccini, Bach's fugues ( the "Grand Fugue in G Minor" is a gift to man), Beethoven (Für Elise, and the Ninth Symphony), and Chopin's Nocturnes.

I love travelling to Italy to visit my relatives​ in Abruzzo, and the Marche regions of Italy. The food is amazing. I enjoy cycling in Southwestern France and the Dolomiti mountains in Italy. Contrary to popular opinion, the French are very friendly, and I have a lot of affection for them despite my mothers French Huguenot roots. Her ancestors fled from France to Southampton, England in 1562 fleeing religious persecution as Protestants. Thank God for England. What is ironic is that she is a direct descendant of Isabella of Angouleme, the French Queen Consort of England, and mother of King Henry III of England. Like her ancestral grandmother before her,  she found herself in England rather than her family's ancestral home of France.

The space
COVID-19 INFORMATION:
With the public health risk posed by coronavirus, we want to let our guests know what steps we are taking to ensure that the guesthouse is clean and safe:

1) Between each visit, we wear masks while cleaning and disinfecting all surfaces, cooking items and dishware with CDC-approved cleaning products.
2) We launder all sheets, towels and pillowcases with hot water (as recommended by the CDC) and natural laundry detergent and disinfecting Borax.
3) We do our best to observe social dist

We're surrounded by nature (expect nightly coyote choruses), convenient to the city and the beach, and we have a vibrant, eclectic community of our own. We're happy to direct you to the best places to eat, drink, shop, and explore in Topanga and beyond (check our Guidebook for a preview).

name_left: TOPANGA CANYON - peaceful and gorgeous !
description:
Topanga means "above the clouds". High up in the S.M. mountains, yet 17 min to the beach, 30 min to Santa Monica/ Malibu & 40 min to dwtn LA ! Sleep in the heavenly quiet of the mountains. Enjoy your morning coffee/tea, or a glass of wine at dusk with spectacular mountain views from the living room, or deck/patio. Visit with homeowners Kenny & Lorna, or just keep to yourself. We are 1 block from the trailhead (dogs okay!) or a short 10 min drive to Topanga St. Park
(no dogs allowed in TSP !)

The space
Kitchen and refrigerator use available upon request.
$20 cleaning fee.
Additional $20 for one (friendly and socialized) dog. (no cats please)
Our home is clean, neat, tidy, colorful, artistic and very comfortable. This is Topanga....we are outside in the country and our doors are wide open most of the time, so if you are looking for a bit of paradise hiding in the middle of LA County, this may be the perfect place for you!

Guest
neighborhood_overview: Beautiful setting high up in the Santa Monica mountains. 7 minute drive to the center of the village, Pine Tree Circle, where you will find shops, restaurants, art gallery, small neighborhood market and post office. Topanga prides itself on being neighbors with a variety of wildlife

name_left: Yurt in Topanga
description:
Yurt in Topanga is nestled high on Observation with a private patio that overlooks the canyon. The Yurt has a sizable living space, a full sized bed with an antique frame, new mattress and a goose down comforter, large walk-in closet, full bathroom shower/tub, kitchenette, and wifi.

The space
The property where the yurt resides has a storied history. The Yellow house was a dance hall speakeasy in the 30s. Visitors from Hollywood stayed in cabins and partied at the Yellow House. Music legends played at the Yellow House. A ranch down the street was homesteaded with nothing but a illegal liqueur still.

Later the Yellow House was the home of Ken Shapiro, who was instrumental in creating Saturday Night Live. When he lived here, The National Lampoon crowd as well as Robin Williams (who live across the street), Chevy Chase, John Belushi wrote and performed at the Yellow House.

Guest access
You’ll have access to the Yurt, patio and Topa
host_about: Sarah and Geoff are both visual artists, educators and parents. Sarah is a Market Manager for several Certified Farmers Markets in Los Angeles.  Geoff is a painter, media artist and teacher. We came to Topanga from Venice, where we lived on Abbot Kinney for 10 years. Sarah and Geoff met and lived in NYC prior to moving to LA. Sarah is from the East coast and Geoff grew up in Minneapolis, Minnesota. Our family includes Donovan, who is 15 years old, Gwyneth is 11 and three loving dogs of all sizes, big, medium and small. We enjoy the outdoors, creative pursuits, music and fantastic food.

**CORONAVIRUS UPDATE BELOW**

Private, bright, spacious yet cozy one-bedroom bungalow in the heart of Topanga nestled under oak trees. Warm furnishings, sculptural custom lighting and a gas fireplace create a welcoming, magical feel inside. Canyon views, and lots of hiking trails nearby. *******************

Please understand that we are doing our best to accommodate for our guests while responsibly f
neighborhood_overview: Topanga offers the best of both worlds: a small town tucked in nature within the bustling city of LA. It has always been a creative haven, inspiring artists, nature lovers, families, spirit seekers and business folk who desire a break from the city at the end of the day. There is much to explore within the Topanga area, from biking and hiking to surfing and swimming. Also, a perfect place to write, read, wind down and enjoy the stars.
host_about:
LA native, sushi fanatic, travel junkie.  I'm a full-time vacation rental host and I am always available for my guests and will do all the work so you can relax on your vacation or work trip.  I've been hosting since 2013 and am serious about making your stay perfect.

Every home is designed for comfort but with its own distinct character. It's no surprise we get many repeat guests who will stay at any of our available properties.  We manage a curated collection of luxury and unique properties in Malibu, Topanga, West LA, and Silver Lake/Echo Park.

name_left: 1925 Cabin: The Sweetest Spot in Topanga
description:
This sweet little cottage was built in 1925 as a simple hunting cabin. Back then, Hollywood legend Charlie Chaplin and friends rented places like this to hunt deer. Only a few original cabins still exist, and this one has been restored for your every comfort. The day of the hunter in Topanga is long past (unless you're a mountain lion), but the gathering has just begun! Gather your family or a few friends or just gather yourself. The wildlife's still here and the tranquility is better than ever!

The space
We will consider some pets on a case by case basis, for an extra fee. Please inquire before booking.

Guest access
The whole house is yours. Very private. 2 parking spaces. There is only one close neighboring house, and we ask that you respect our neighbors. Once you're inside or on the deck, you can't even see another house. Fabulous hiking right out the door!

Other things to note
We absolutely rent to all races, gen
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is treed and hilly, with horse ranches and houses sprinkled around. Access to the Topanga State Park (one of LA's true treasures)  is a short walk from the house!
host_about: We are a family of 4. Mike is a cinematographer in Hollywood. Lynn is a documentary writer/director. We have two great kids: Jackson is 20 and Nora is 16. We also have 2 dogs, Loki & Hendricks, and a dozen or so chickens.  We are really enjoying having airbnb guests at the cabin.  Everyone has been lovely and very appreciative of our unique locale. We love to travel ourselves, so it's great fun to meet others who share that passion. But don't worry... we mostly leave you alone to enjoy the place!

Lives in Topanga since 2012. Married to a Native Topangan in 2016.

Just 6 miles to the ocean and Topanga Beach or the San Fernando Valley. Malibu and Santa Monica are a 15-20 minute drive. Adjacent to Topanga State Park, with its vast hiking trails. Our home is quiet & peaceful with views across a field to a mountain ridge. This elegant modern, warm architectural retreat has every feature that a visitor might want in a country setting. Designed by an award-winning architect it is extremely functional yet incredibly warm and livable.

The space
Entire house is yours. We have almost everything you could want - 2 flat panels TV's with HBO, Netflix and Amazon Prime, Internet WiFi, an Audiophile Sound System with Sonos, a Spa-like bathroom with deep soaking tub, an open gourmet kitchen, and washer & dryer. The house is light filled with many windows or window walls in every room. Yet with all the glass there is complete privacy. Neighboring houses are hidden from view. There is a small intimate dining deck and a large deck overloo
neighborhood_overview:
You can have it both ways: enjoy southern California nature with its mountains and oceans and experience the excitment of one of the world's most dynamic cites. Topanga is a mountainous paradise within proximity all of this.
Our house is located within the village of Topanga and has a number of excellent restaurants, galleries, coffee shops, and even an outdoor Shakespearean theater only a 10 minute minute walk away.
This modern sanctuary is just 6 miles to the ocean or 6 miles to Woodand Hills in the San Fernando Valley. Malibu and Santa Monica are a 15-20 minute drive away. We sit adjacent to Topanga State Park, with its vast hiking trails and considered the largest urban park in the world. You can hike from our house directly into the park. Our home is quiet & peaceful with views across a field to a mountain ridge.

name_left: Family Bungalow nestled in the heart of Topanga
description:
Located right near the heart of town in nature soaked Topanga Canyon, on a quiet dead end street. This is the perfect spot for families. Less than 10 minutes to the beach. Walk to town or hike into Topanga State Park from this cozy Topanga home. We really have the best of both worlds being so surrounded by nature and still being able to walk to yoga, the library, coffee shop or our cute Topanga shops.

The space
Our home is bright and airy and kid friendly! You first walk into the open living/dining area that has 4 sky lights and windows all around. Two sets of sliding glass doors lead to a big deck with views of Topanga Canyon Blvd and the mountains. I am a professional cook, so our kitchen is fully equipped with everything you might need. There is a full bathroom with a large tub upstairs. Heading downstairs, you walk into the first bedroom and playroom. This room has a full size Keetsa mattress. This room doesn't have a lot of privacy, since you have t
neighborhood_overview: Topanga Canyon is located in the Santa Monica Mountains with easy access to the beaches in Santa Monica, Venice, Malibu, as well as to the clubs and restaurants in Hollywood and Downtown. The experience is of being in the country while being in a large metropolitan city. This is very unique and why I chose to live here after moving from Brooklyn in 2016.  Topanga Canyon does have several good restaurants, cafés and coffee shops. There are two general markets for groceries but better to round up supplies on your way "up the hill". The road is a typical canyon road; two lane and curvy.
