We are nestled in the canyon, near the fabulous Topanga Living Cafe, and only seven miles from the beach. Woodland Hills is just over the hill, and Venice Beach & Santa Monica are just an ocean-side drive away. You'll be staying in one of the premier nature getaways of Los Angeles, in a unique artist's home.

The space
The home has two bedrooms (on the top and bottom levels), as well as a small nook with a twin bed next to the master bedroom. The home has 2.5 bathrooms, easily accessible on each level (the half bath is just off the kitchen/dining area). You'll have three bathtubs to enjoy, one being a luxurious outdoor claw foot bath in a side garden with canyon views. The large master bathroom has a jacuzzi tub, which can comfortably fit two adults. You'll also enjoy a king size bed in the master bedroom, with a balcony overlooking the can
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is "charming Topanga"... nestled in nature, quite and friendly...It was and is a haven for artists of all disciplines.  The hideaway of poets, painters, actors and musicians who have chosen to leave the hectic city life for rural ambiance.
host_about: I am a mother and professional photographer and multi-media artist. I have a sweet family with my husband , daughter and dog. We like to make our home our creative sanctuary and travel.

name_left: Magical Topanga Getaway
description:
Spacious canyon home set on 1.5 acres with sweeping views and a large flat yard with a swing set. Surrounded by trees, you’ll enjoy dining outside to the sound of owls and frogs. Conveniently close to Topanga Canyon Blvd, yet set back enough for privacy. Enjoy a popular hike and Topanga’s best eateries within walking distance. Rooms are all very spacious. Dining table comfortably seats 10. Enjoy modern conveniences or zen out and stargaze. Child & dog friendly! Weekly and monthly discounts.

The space
We have a lovely view of the ridge and a large flat yard, which is not typical for this area. Our yard has a swing set and drought-tolerant landscaping. There is a fenced in backyard for dogs. Our home is a single story home with extra large rooms. We have a playroom stocked with toys for the little ones.

Other things to note
Topanga Canyon is a very special community. There is wonderful hiking and wildlife, yet you are also close to the city
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is centrally located in Topanga Canyon. We are 15 minutes from the valley and 15 minutes from the beach. Within walking distance of our home you’ll find Topanga Living Cafe, a lovely new addition to the neighborhood. Within a minute drive you will find Topanga Table, another new restaurant serving delicious breakfast. We are a two minute drive to the community center and playground, as well as Will Greer’s Theatricum Botanicum outdoor theater.

We love living in our community for the unique local businesses, great hiking with incredible views and the solitude. Not to mention the Topanga Beach within 5 miles from our home! It is a rare gem in the Los Angeles area.
host_about: I have lived in Topanga, California for eight years. I work in advertising and I’m a professional career coach. I have a daughter in elementary school and two dogs. When I grow up we want to own a B&B in the country. For now, I love to travel and want to share our home with others who enjoy nature as much as we do.

name_left: Redwood House, Two Bedroom Topanga Home Under the Oaks
description:
Lie in a hammock listening to birdsong and a fountain. Sleep beneath dream catchers and fairylights. Sculptural lighting and lovingly curated art pepper airy, plant-filled rooms. Beyond expansive windows, alfresco dining and canyon views beckon.

PLEASE NOTE: Hiking from the backyard is not accessible at this time due to extremely strict Private Property enforcement by the neighbors during coronavirus, as the neighboring path is Private Property. There are stunning hikes within a five minute drive.

A magical escape from the city yet less than 5 minutes to many restaurants & 15 minutes to the beach.

While we understand this is a very picturesque location, any filming, photography, or non-standard use of the space is not included in a regular reservation and must be pre-approved and will be quoted based on the scope and time frame of the project.
neighborhood_overview: A small town tucked in nature within bustling LA, Topanga is an inspiring, creative haven. Discover endless trails nearby, stunning views, and California wildlife-spotting opportunities. Master bedroom with luxurious king bed, giant dream catcher, and plenty of natural light. 2nd bedroom with queen bed and sliding glass doors to the outside. Master bathroom with lush soaking tub, 2nd bathroom with marble-tiled shower and washer/dryer. Three cabins on the property, each with a unique offering.
host_about:
LA native, sushi fanatic, travel junkie.  I'm a full-time vacation rental host and I am always available for my guests and will do all the work so you can relax on your vacation or work trip.  I've been hosting since 2013 and am serious about making your stay perfect.

Every home is designed for comfort but with its own distinct character. It's no surprise we get many repeat guests who will stay at any of our available properties.  We manage a curated collection of luxury and unique properties in Malibu, Topanga, West LA, and Silver Lake/Echo Park.

name_left: Room with a view
description:
Conveniently located between the Valley and the Ocean, Topanga is the perfect weekend getaway. My house is located next to 70 miles of trails in Topanga State Park, on a street with almost no neighbors, no traffic, & no noise except for the sound of frogs, our resident peacocks, and an occasional coyote. My house is both cozy and filled with light. The 2000 sq. ft. deck is a spectacular place to have breakfast, spend a day in the Hammock, enjoy the view, or watch the sunset from our hot tub.

The space
My home is one of a kind. You will be surrounded by nature from the moment you arrive. At night you will fall asleep in a comfortable bed under a goose down duvet while listening to the soothing sounds of crickets, frogs and owls. In the morning we always have coffee, an assortment of teas, and granola, Muesli, yogurt, berries, bananas, milk and almond milk for breakfast.
neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is rural and quiet. There are no sidewalks and few cars. Two different entrances to Topanga State Park (the largest enclosed natural park in a city in the world) and hundreds of miles of hiking, biking and horseback riding trails are walking distance from my house. The Room With A View is a great place to come for a quiet personal retreat but it is also just 15 minutes from Santa Monica, Venice beach, Malibu, world-class Surfing,  Stand Up Paddle Boarding , The Santa Monica Pier, and the amazing shopping of Santa Monica's Third Street Promenade, and The Village in Woodland Hills.

So peaceful and serene you see stars at night, wake to the sounds of birds chirping, and hiking trails out your backdoor. You are minutes to the famous Topanga surf break, Santa Monica and Malibu and just over the hill are Calabasas and Woodland Hills with amazing restaurants and shopping. Come and experience the magical energy of Topanga.

Guest access

name_left: Take it Easy in the Rustic Courtyard at a Mountain Escape
description: Settle down in the canopied bed and watch beautiful native birds at this breezy bohemian studio with views of the mountain ridge. Carefully curated interiors showcase original artwork by local artists and bouquets of seasonal flowers from the garden.
neighborhood_overview: The breeze blows up from the ocean in the Fernwood area of Topanga. There are beautiful dirt trails through lush gullies and on top of ridges overlooking the pacific a short walk from the house, while Topanga Beach is a quick ride down Tuna Canyon.

name_left: Spectacular Topanga House near Beach and Parks
description:
Extraordinary location in famous Topanga Canyon! 2-bdr/3 bath house in the Santa Monica Mountains (near Malibu). 1600 sf indoors, large living room, spectacular views, PLUS addl. 2800 sf of outdoor decks with all furniture, bar, grill, deck shower, cool tub, + outdoor futon to sleep under the stars! Fall asleep to the gentle hoot of the owls and song of the coyotes. Parking onsite. Surrounded by wilderness, parks and hiking trails. 5 miles/10 minutes to the beach! World-class restaurants.

The space
We are renting the main living spaces of our house. There is also a guest apartment on the property that is occupied by a tenant. It has a separate entrance.

Other things to note
IMPORTANT: There are two indoor cats in the house. Everyone in the house should be aware that they are not allowed outside at any time, or they might fall prey to coyotes, hawks or owls in the area. Please take care to close all doors when entering & exiting the house.
neighborhood_overview:
The small market (general store and grocery store) in Topanga village has a limited offering and relatively high prices. We recommend going to a grocery store in Calabasas or Woodland Hills (15 min. drive). Ralphs, Bristol Farms, Whole Foods and Trader Joes are all nearby. There is also a Von's market on PCH at Sunset Blvd.
For restaurants in Topanga, we recommend The Canyon Bistro, Topanga Table, Inn of the 7th Ray, or Roccos Pizza—offering a good variety of prices and cuisine.

description:
Beautiful 3 bed 2 bath furnished home on 1 acre. Minutes walk to 10000acre topanga state park with hiking, mountain biking and horseback riding trails.Huge deck with mountain views.Quiet cul du sac.outdoor shower under the oaks.5 miles to Topanga beach.45 mins to LAX. country feeling.light and airy. nature .parking.

The space
you are minutes from a major city yet you feel like you are in the country. there is an overwhelming feeling of peace and tranquility. you are surrounded by nature. you are relaxed the minute you arrive and sit on our deck overlooking a vineyard and olive grove.Eggs from our happy free range chickens....

Guest access
the complete house is available.there is off road parking.
host_about: I am married with 2 amazing grown children.I have lived in paradise (Topanga) for 20 years and would like to share my piece of heaven with you.I was born in Bangkok Thailand ,raised in Sydney Australia,moved to Montreal Canada for high school,then to Winnipeg Canada for university in  business.Moved to New York to work with the airlines, air Lingus South African air,and Canadian (Website hidden by Airbnb) my wife in new York and moved to her home town in Los Angeles.First Venice Beach Then to Topanga .I live to travel  eat and enjoy life as much as i possibly can while i am on this earth.I love the ocean, nature, photography,sunsets,time with friends and family, swimming, skiing,sailing ,horseback riding,hiking,good music of any kind.I have travelled the world many times over.My favorite places are Denmark New Zealand Chile Galapagos Islands.I spent 13 months travelling South America.1 year travelling  the South Pacific and Orient.I love to cook foods from all over the world.I love to share my love of life with others through where i live , food,and spending time with like minded people.  life motto : i can sleep when i am dead.

name_left: THE SIREN SUITE Bohemian Elegance, Maximum Romance
description:
THE SIREN SUITE. Spacious, sumptuous hexagonal private bedroom with ensuite bath and kitchenette located in the tower wing of the Mountain Mermaid, a restored 1930's country club. Surrounded by the largest urban wilderness in America. Luxuriate in the antique Victorian feather bed, the immense great room, or swim in the gorgeous pool. Expansive grounds, ten fountains, and mountain views, Two guests only please, no parties, pets, loud music or loud voices, as noise carries in the quiet canyon..

The space
This listing is one of three gorgeous private suites at The Mountain Mermaid, a grand three-story rural residential estate with a remarkable history. The Mountain Mermaid was originally built as a country club in 1930 and later had various lives as one of gangster Micky Choen's LA gambling houses during the war, a gay nightclub in the 50s and 60s, and the infamous Mermaid Tavern during the 1970s, a celebrated concert hall featuring word-class musical talent. Now
host_about: Long-story-short, I was born in Los Angeles, love art, houses and history, grew weary of working for others as a commercial illustrator, so became my own boss reclaiming and preserving old buildings.

name_left: Greenleaf Ranch / Master bedroom wing
description:
Hello ! Welcome to your beautiful and private escape located in the Santa Monica Mountains conservation area in the legendary small town of Topanga Canyon. Your accommodations are up a 1.5 mile private drive on a large 10 acre property in the midst of a protected old growth California Live Oak Tree grove and seasonal stream that runs through the property. You will be staying in the master bedroom which has its own wing and is separate from the rest of the Villa.

The space
The main house is a Southern California warehouse style modern design marked with large beams and lofty open ceilings. The large beams and supports that run throughout the building were salvaged from the original Venice / O.P. pier after fell into disuse in the late 70's. The open plan design allows you to see the historic marks from the old pier connections and underpinnings left over when the pier infamously caught fire and mostly burnt down . Just leaving a small amount of the original pi
neighborhood_overview:
You and your companion will have access to many beautiful hiking and mountain biking trails with in the Santa Monica Mountains Conservation and Recreation area. You can walk out the backdoor and access many that are very close or you can drive to a special place like the Red Rocks located within Topanga State park (10 min drive to trail head parking area) or choose from many many other amazing gems in the surrounding area.

*Also please visit the nearby world famous beaches in Venice Beach, Santa Monica, and Malibu. All are relatively close by car or uber. Topanga State beach is just down the canyon 6 miles away.
host_about:
Hello folks,

I am a photographer / filmmaker who likes to travel and experience new things and cultures. Very down to earth and love to interact with others. Happy to host polite and like minded people.

name_left: Clean, Quiet, Tipi w/WiFi, in Wilderness Near LA 2
description:
Small, unique, CDC clean Tipi in a wilderness location, less than an hour from LA or LAX. 20 minutes to the beach, unusually quiet with lots of friendly wildlife; foxes, rabbits, deer, all live here and can be seen daily. 5 minute hike to your car safe in an exclusive gated 4 acre property. Day use only. Relax while working on WiFi, swinging peacefully in a hammock, or exploring America's most iconic, traditional dwelling.

The space
For your health and peace of mind we have fully implemented the CDC’s guidelines in cleaning and sanitizing your premises before your visit without using products with residual toxicity.

You will need is good footwear for the short steep-ish, hike in (High heels are not good, but I usually hike in with my flip-flops) You will want to bring the food you need for your stay, camera and perhaps a change of wardrobe. You will not need additional bedding, towels, eating/cookware all of that is provided. You will have power
neighborhood_overview: As with many communities that host Airbnb we have a mix of neighbors which I can expand on when you arrive if you like but we are far enough from the trodden path that you are unlikely to have any interaction, which is just as well, considering that most of them are here to get away from all the people as well.
host_about:
I am a 30 year veteran of the Adventure Sports/Commercial Television and Film World.  I grew up between the Mountains of Colorado, in Vail and Aspen, and a large cattle ranch in Northwest Montana.  After a year of school at Prescott College in Arizona and several more shooting ski films in Colorado, I moved to North Hollywood where I lasted about 6 months before fleeing to Half Moon Bay.  I eventually made it back to Hollywood because of "The Business" and for about 5 years lived on my sailboat.  Throughout this time I was traveling the world shooting films and first kayak descents of rivers and ski descents of mountains.  About 10 years ago I met my sweetheart at the Premier of an IMAX Film called "Mystery of the Nile" we shot while making the first "Source to Sea" descent of the Nile.  After a couple of years living in the Marina we decided to settle in Topanga with our young family.  As luck would have it, we found a magical piece of property, with direct access to over 100 miles of hiking/mountain biking trails through Topanga State Park and adjacent wild areas, while being only 22 miles direct from downtown Los Angeles.  Now I am able to work closer to home and family.  Airbnb along with some beautiful property with stunning views is helping fulfill that dream....
As far as hosting, I would personally like to make everyone who stays with us a lifelong friend but I am also just happy to share a such a beautiful place so close to the city, yet so far away from all the noise and haste!  
If you decide to stay with us, you are welcome to request additional services like breakfast, cappuccino or a shuttle to the airport, direction and information on local resources.  We will do what we can to make sure our guests have a wonderful stay in a truly magical place with no worries about the small stuff.

name_left: Love Stream Romantic Nature Getaway in Topanga, CA
description:
Two vintage Airstreams under 100 year old oaks at animal sanctuary and rescue. Come stay in our renovated 1960 Land Yacht Airstream in Topanga, CA surrounded by llamas, sheep, pigs and giant African tortoises. Prepare yourself a snack in our 1948 Wee Wind Airstream gourmet food trailer and relax next to a seasonal creek in Jacuzzi, steam sauna at night & sip wine at fire pit. Hike to nearby ocean views and waterfall at state park. Minutes to beach. The perfect Staycation and romantic getaway!!!

The space
Animal sanctuary and rescue. Bluff over looking seasonal creek. Jacuzzi and sauna on bluff. Certified yoga teacher, certified exercise physiology instructor, certified vegan chef, private animal experience tour and massage services also available. Another Airstream is located on property with intermediate guest. Both are available for short term rentals.

Guest access
Two Airstreams.
Private walkway to spa.
Spa and deck on bluff.
neighborhood_overview: Private and quiet road with amazing neighbors! Houses spread out within the oak trees.
host_about: I am an interior designer by trade and my wife is an exercise physiologist , nutritionist and plant-based chef.  Hospitality is our number one goal. We are long time vegans and animal advocates. We find ourselves incredibly lucky to live in the canyon and Santa Monica mountain range of Topanga. Hikes, nature, water falls, beach and romantic dining are minutes from our retreat. This is the perfect location for our animal rescue ranch foundation.

name_left: The Topanga Bungalows: The Tiny House
description:
Enjoy all that beautiful Topanga Canyon has to offer while resting in our custom designed Topanga Tiny House, one of three rentable units on the property. This magical respite is all you need... in a very small footprint.

Wake up with the sun, listen to the birds chirp while nestled into this cozy little cabin. Enjoy a fresh cup of coffee, get some reading done, or simply take time to relax and reflect.

IG: @thetopangabungalows

The space
Welcome to the Topanga Bungalows! Ideally located, it is just a 10 minute drive down to the beach and only 5 minutes to Topanga's local array of charming restaurants, shops, and hiking trails. This casita's clever layout belies its humble square footage (~300 sq. ft including the back patio). With a lofted bed and a 3/4 bath, this space is ideal for somebody on a solo getaway or a couple looking for a cozy retreat.

The Topanga Tiny House is one of three units on the property. Please also chec
neighborhood_overview: Topanga Canyon is an incredible coastal-mountain community with a rich history in the arts.  Due to restrictive building codes, much of the area is like a time capsule, with cute shops and restaurants that recall a bygone era.  It's a quick 20-minute drive into town, though, where you can see all that Venice Beach, Santa Monica, and other neighborhoods have to offer.
host_about: I am the owner and founder of The Topanga Bungalows, a bespoke, three-unit retreat nestled in the coastal canyon of Topanga, California.

name_left: Feel at home by the Getty Villa & Malibu Beaches!
description:
Exclusive, peaceful Malibu community. Walk to sandy beaches, Getty villa or amazing Topanga surf. Enjoy local restaurants like Rocco's, high end like Nobu, farmer's markets, and world famous beaches!

Master suite has ocean views, a bath any spa retreat would envy; an en-suite second bedroom, walk out deck stretching across back yard with ocean views. Take the circular staircase to the yard to enjoy the garden walk, views, fountains, complete with outdoor kitchen/ BBQ + entertainment area.

The space
Master with en-suite bath and private balcony.

Enjoy the view deck and the luscious back yard.

Guest access
Full access to the house, yard and upper patio. No garage access.

Other things to note
Smoking cigarettes is prohibited. E-cigarettes are included in the state's clean indoor air law.Jun 28, 2019 and therefore banned on property.
neighborhood_overview: Malibu beach community. Enjoy world famous beaches, celebrity spotting, farmer's market and amazing local restaurants. A short drive from downtown Santa Monica, s Pier,  and Third Street Promenade. Watch the sun set over the Santa Monica mountains.

name_left: The Topanga Tree House
description:
Two bedrooms, large private family room, laundry room, cable tv, private bathroom w. soaking tub in a large multistory Treehouse with two family rooms, a full modern kitchen, a meditation loft looking out over the Canyon and State Park, close to amazing hiking trails and the beaches of Malibu on over an acre of beautiful land with organic fruit and vegetables. Incredible view of the Canyon from three different decks. Private guest entrance on second floor. Lots of offstreet parking available.

The space
The Topanga Tree House is located in Upper Fernwood right off Tuna Canyon within walking distance of hiking trails to the State Park and a half mile drive to the Tuna Canyon Mesa Trail with 360 degree views of the LA Basin and ocean. We are a five minute drive to the village of Topanga and a ten minute drive to the beaches of Malibu. Fifteen minutes away from the Getty Villa.

Guest access
Private guest entrance on second floor of house.
neighborhood_overview: Quiet treelined neighborhood in a rural surrounding.  Lots of hikers walking by but you can watch them from afar from your decks.

description:
Beautiful Topanga Cottage with outside dining deck and wood fire. Close walk to red rock trails / hikes

The space
Close to the entrance of Red Rock Canyon, situation on Old Topanga Canyon Road. Electric gate with one parking space for the guesthouse and another space for the main house. Beautifully designed and recently refurbished.

Coded access to the electric gate. Lockbox on site to collect the key. Close to Topanga town and Red Rock Canyon Trail. The guest house has rustic wooden fencing all the outside dining and living area for privacy

name_left: Sanitized, Luxe Topanga Canyon Bungalow Under the Oaks
description:
Light candles in lanterns hanging from ancient oaks and relax to the sounds of nature. Lots of outdoor seating to enjoy the mountain views. Curl up by a log fire on chilly nights.

Surround yourself in the nature of the canyon while still enjoying little luxuries like Le Lab o soap and a heated bathroom floor.

Fits two adults comfortably and up to two kids. One king bed in bedroom, Restoration Hardware down sofa, child's cot, & crib provided.

Please note there is street noise from Topanga Canyon Blvd during the day, at night it's typically very quiet. A/C is a portable unit in living room.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is in Topanga Canyon, tucked away among hundred-year-old oak trees. It's close to surf spots and hiking trails in the Santa Monica Mountains—yet still close to the city for fine dining.

Cozy bungalow at the end of a short, gated private road with all the comforts you could need. Full kitchen with Chemex pour over, French press, coffee maker, stove, dishwasher, and everything for enjoying meals at home.

One king bed in bedroom, Resoration Hardware sofa, child's cot, & crib provided.
host_about:
LA native, sushi fanatic, travel junkie.  I'm a full-time vacation rental host and I am always available for my guests and will do all the work so you can relax on your vacation or work trip.  I've been hosting since 2013 and am serious about making your stay perfect.

Every home is designed for comfort but with its own distinct character. It's no surprise we get many repeat guests who will stay at any of our available properties.  We manage a curated collection of luxury and unique properties in Malibu, Topanga, West LA, and Silver Lake/Echo Park.

name_left: Camp Fernwood - The Canyon Cabin Above The Sea
description:
Private log cabin is the perfect retreat in Topanga's Fernwood area. Recently remodeled to capture & restore the emotion of a cozy log cabin whilst offering new walk-in shower, hardwood floors & bathroom, the open ceiling & rustic logs are the perfect backdrop for the more modern finishes. Sits in its own garden & boasts a large deck with incredible views & sun rises. Fully furnished with a small kitchen, reading nook and electric fireplace. An artist's escape to write, read and recharge.

The space
Nestled in a beautiful a peaceful corner of this large private garden with easy access to the scenic Topanga State Parks and beaches. The Santa Monica Mountain skyline and miles of trails are found just off the property.

Guest access
The cabin is a private structure with its own bathroom and private deck. You will not share any spaces with others and the main house is a good distance from the cabin. Easy private parking on the property. Self chec
neighborhood_overview:
Topanga town center and nearby Malibu, Pacific Palisades and Santa Monica have shopping centers, restaurants, wine tasting, hiking, cycling, surfing, paddle boarding, horse back riding and so much more.

A fun winding canyon drive down to the beach just 8 minutes away with world class surf breaks at Topanga Beach and another 5 minutes along the Pacific Coast Highway to Malibu Pier.

Great location to experience Los Angeles in a unique and relaxing way.
host_about: Creative couple living in the mountains of Los Angeles with our pup, Gnarly. We are active cyclists, trail runners and backpackers always looking for an excuse to be outdoors exploring while pushing ourselves physically and mentally. We call Topanga home because it is the perfect calm and beauty we need in our otherwise busy day-to-day lives working in advertising. We hope our log cabin with all its unique touches makes you feel the sense of escape and comfort you are looking for.

Memory foam queen bed, million-dollar views, super quiet yet close to everything, a happy find for the discriminating traveler. We enjoy entertaining, yet are as respectful of privacy as you want us to be. Parking spot is covered and just a few yards from your private entry.

The space
I hope you have time to enjoy our hilltop reserve. The space and amenities spell ‘relax’ in a big way! We are handy to the Warner Center, Santa Monica Mountains, ocean and much more!

Guest access
Guests have access to outdoor patios and sitting areas (gazebo, fountains, lounge chairs, etc) and laundry (by arrangement).

Other things to note
I am open to having well-behaved, small sized pet stay with you as long as he or she is not left unattended on the property. I have a cat and small dog that are not allowed in the guest suite.

If you would like to make use of the big kitchen during your stay, that can be negotiated for
neighborhood_overview: My home is located at the end of a quiet cul d’sac within a safe, friendly mobile home development . A scenic drive through the mountains ends at the Pacific Ocean and Topanga State Beach.
host_about: I am a 63 year old professional violinist; fit as a fiddle, interested in all areas of life and a particular lover of nature. I have a wonderful significant other named Inga and an 18 year old daughter studying music at the Manhattan School of Music.

name_left: Crystal Cabin, Restored Vintage Lodge in Topanga State Park
description:
Step into a romantic getaway that seems a million miles from anywhere. A stone fireplace now serves a decorative purpose and adds to the rustic charm of pine paneling. Original stained-glass windows. Newly-built, modern kitchen.

Original Topanga lodge remodeled in 2019: open ceiling for a vaulted look with exposed beams. Cozy dining or reading nook perfect for enjoying the sunshine, outdoor seating and hammock for relaxing under the giant oaks. Intended for up to 2 adults.

NOTE: No hiking from house into neighbors land. There are 3 cabins on the property, each with its own private space.
neighborhood_overview:
The cabin is off the main road in Topanga State Park, just outside of LA. It's a quick trip to charming coffee shops and restaurants, as well as the town center. The beach is just down the hill, and is a surfing destination.

Lots of hiking trails within a short drive.

Sample driving times:

The Topanga Table: 2 minutes
Inn of the Seventh Ray: 4 min
Topanga Beach: 14 min
Malibu Pier: 18 min
Getty Villa: 18 min
Nobu Malibu: 20 min
Santa Monica Pier: 20 min
LAX: 35 min

name_left: Spacious mid-century modern oasis near the beach
description:
Settle into our large, contemporary mid-century-modern home nestled in the scenic Santa Monica Mountains National Park, with beautiful Topanga State Park just outside your door and picturesque Malibu beaches a 10-minute drive.

Set on one acre of protected oak woodlands, the house features an expansive outdoor deck for enjoying the broad views toward the Malibu hills and some of the best sunsets ever. The open floor plan living area provides perfect space for gathering with family and friends.

The space
Our large home in the beautiful Canyon is a perfect base for exploring Los Angeles, Santa Monica, Malibu and the rest of southern California. Topanga State Park, a 3-minute walk away, is America's largest urban wildland and part of the Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area, with miles of trails where you can see deer, coyotes, bobcats, hawks and other wildlife. Our farm-like property features gardens, a chicken coop and a friendly pig named He
neighborhood_overview: Eclectic Topanga Canyon is known as a haven for artist and musicians, and is set in one of the most beautiful coastal mountain ranges in California, nestled between Malibu and Santa Monica, and a short drive from the rest of Los Angeles. The town features coffee spots, restaurants, shops and a general store.

name_left: Retreat from the City in a Boho-Chic Hillside Bolt-hole
description: Listen to the birds and watch wildlife hidden away in the sleepy hills of Topanga. An easy drive from the city, this bijou duplex pays homage to Gypset style and boasts rural canyon views, a yoga platform, private entry, and off-street parking.
neighborhood_overview: Topanga is a short drive from the Malibu coastline, renowned for surf spots and beautiful beaches. Head toward Calabasas to find San Fernando Valley's fabulous shopping and restaurants. Hollywood and Santa Monica are both a picturesque drive away.
host_about:
Hi my name is Tara, married mother of one. 
I enjoy spending time with my family,  friends and dogs, taking in what beautiful Southern California has to offer in both the beach and mountains surrounding us daily.  I teach yoga both privately and in studio throughout Los Angeles. 
 
We are opening up our private extended space to visitors from all over and are very much looking forward to providing a place  that can be enjoyed.

Having done extensive traveling around the world, we know how any single place or experiences can leave a blissful imprint in your memory forever, and we’re happy to be apart of the memories. While hoping to create new lasting ones for ourselves.

name_left: Tiny Home in Topanga Village (5)
description:
Social Distancing Approved Nature Getaway! Unique Tiny Home in Topanga Canyon with large glass doors that open to private yard. Renovated with modern amenities; kitchenette, contemporary bathroom, and cozy bedroom. **Health and safety of our guests is top priority. Extra cleanliness precautions ensure commonly used surfaces are thoroughly cleaned. Short or long-term stay. A 5-minute walk (30-second drive) to Topanga Village which includes restaurants, shopping, and entertainment.

The space
This property is in a funky little RV park called Little Fox Trailer Court. The property was built in the 1950s. There are 5 units in the community with 4 classic aluminum trailers including Spartan, Streamline, and Silver Streak. It also includes this cute Tiny Home that was recently renovated for your comfort. Please check out our other listings called "Airstream Glamping in Nature." https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/24355057?s=51 and "Glamping Airstream in Topanga Village"
neighborhood_overview:
Topanga is the perfect blend of mountain town meets the sparkling Southern California ocean and best surf breaks. Along the coast, Topanga is located in between Santa Monica and Malibu. It is also conveniently located in between the Valley and the Ocean. Its perfect for someone who wants to feel like there away, but still being close to the action.

One of the most romantic restaurants in all of Los Angeles is within walking distance to the Tiny Home. The restaurant is called Inn of the Seventh Ray.

name_left: Clean, Quiet,Tipi w/WiFi, in Wilderness Near LA
description:
One of 2 Tipis, Perfect Location in Topanga Canyon, less than an hour from LA or LAX. Only 20 minutes to the beach, unusually quiet and photogenic, lots of friendly wildlife; foxes, rabbits, deer, all visit the property daily. 5 minute hike to your car, safe inside an exclusive gated 4 acre property with WiFi so you can work for the day.

The space
For your health and peace of mind during these uncertain times, I have implemented the CDC’s guidelines in sanitizing your space after the last guest’s visit. You can reserve one or both tipi’s depending on your group’s size and need for privacy, and health concerns.

All you will need is good footwear for the short steepish, hike in (High heels are not good, but I usually hike in with my flip-flops) You will want to bring takeaway and cameras for a perfect retreat. There are plenty of hiking opportunities. In fact you have literally hundreds of miles of hiking right from the Tipi. Search "Backbone Trail To
neighborhood_overview: As with many communities that host Airbnb we have a mix of neighbors which I can expand on when you arrive if you like but we are far enough from the trodden path that you are unlikely to have any interaction, which is just as well, considering that most of them are here to get away as well.
host_about:
I am a 30 year veteran of the Adventure Sports/Commercial Television and Film World.  I grew up between the Mountains of Colorado, in Vail and Aspen, and a large cattle ranch in Northwest Montana.  After a year of school at Prescott College in Arizona and several more shooting ski films in Colorado, I moved to North Hollywood where I lasted about 6 months before fleeing to Half Moon Bay.  I eventually made it back to Hollywood because of "The Business" and for about 5 years lived on my sailboat.  Throughout this time I was traveling the world shooting films and first kayak descents of rivers and ski descents of mountains.  About 10 years ago I met my sweetheart at the Premier of an IMAX Film called "Mystery of the Nile" we shot while making the first "Source to Sea" descent of the Nile.  After a couple of years living in the Marina we decided to settle in Topanga with our young family.  As luck would have it, we found a magical piece of property, with direct access to over 100 miles of hiking/mountain biking trails through Topanga State Park and adjacent wild areas, while being only 22 miles direct from downtown Los Angeles.  Now I am able to work closer to home and family.  Airbnb along with some beautiful property with stunning views is helping fulfill that dream....
As far as hosting, I would personally like to make everyone who stays with us a lifelong friend but I am also just happy to share a such a beautiful place so close to the city, yet so far away from all the noise and haste!  
If you decide to stay with us, you are welcome to request additional services like breakfast, cappuccino or a shuttle to the airport, direction and information on local resources.  We will do what we can to make sure our guests have a wonderful stay in a truly magical place with no worries about the small stuff.

name_left: Das Gasthaus
description:
Das Gasthaus is nestled within the Santa Monica Mountains in the hippie-chic town of Topanga. It has amazing views and is surrounded by many beautiful hikes. This oasis is just a short drive to the beach and close to everything Topanga has to offer. Private and comfortable, this one bedroom apartment is located on the lower level of our property. Come relax and enjoy this brand new one bedroom apartment!

The space
Das Gasthaus features beautiful canyon views in a quiet, serene environment that is close to everything Topanga has to offer. It is a comfortable one bedroom apartment located on the lower level of the main house. It can accommodate up to 4 guests comfortably. There are 3 beds (2 twin size & 1 queen size) and 1 spacious bathroom. The space includes one large living space, one small bedroom, a full bathroom, and a kitchen with: a kitchenette, a refrigerator, a freezer compartment, stove top, and a microwave with an integrated oven. There is a Nespresso
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Das Gasthaus!
Topanga is the name given to the place by a Native American tribe and means “a place above”. In the 1920s, Topanga Canyon became a weekend getaway for Hollywood stars, providing both privacy and attractive surroundings for the rich and famous. Topanga Canyon encompasses the land of the Topanga State Park, which is the largest park in the Santa Mountains and one of the most well preserved, vast and open spaces within a city context. It is a beautiful, bohemian town nestled in the mountains above the Santa Monica mountains. Just a short, 8-minute drive down to the most breath taking Malibu beaches, and an even shorter drive to lovely hikes overlooking the elegant scenery of Los Angeles. Topanga is an inspiring place, filled with artists, musicians, writers, families, locals and many more. Away from all the tourism, a visitor is granted access to one of the least known, yet most loved nooks in the Los Angeles county. As relaxing as your stay in Topanga will

name_left: Topanga Treehouse
description:
Multistory Architectural Treehouse hanging off the Canyon Wall, look out over the State Park, minutes from amazing hiking trails & the beaches of Malibu on an acre of beautiful land, organic fruit & vegetables. Incredible view of the Canyon from three different decks. w two large family rooms. 4 romantic bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, one w a river rock shower & the second bathroom has a claw foot tub. Full kitchen w juicer and blender. And meditation loft. Plenty of Off-street parking and privacy.

The space
The Topanga Tree House is located in Upper Fernwood right off Tuna Canyon within walking distance of hiking trails to the State Park and a half mile drive to the Tuna Canyon Mesa Trail with 360 degree views of the LA Basin and ocean. We are a five minute drive to the village of Topanga and a ten minute drive to the beaches of Malibu. Fifteen minutes away from the Getty Villa.

Guest access
Private guest entrance on second floor of house. W

description:
LIVE THE LA BEACH DREAM. This stunning Architectural home was built by award winning Architects Shubin Donaldson. You will never want to leave this inspiring 4 bedroom 4 bathroom home with Jaw Dropping Ocean views. Experience Californian living at its very best. Located at the beginning of Malibu it’s Just 5 -7 minute walk to the beach & The Getty Villa and only 10 minute drive from Santa Monica, Downtown Malibu and Pacific Palisades.

ENJOY A PLUNGE POOL/SPA WITH PANORAMIC OCEAN VIEWS.

The space
The flow of this stunning 4bedroom, 4bathroom home is superb. Boasting indoor and outdoor dining with exquisite ocean views from every major room, including the Master bedroom with en-suite bathroom, luxurious free-standing tub and shower. Additional 3 bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms. There is also a great hang out/media room for children. Please note this home is not suitable for children under 10 years of age. Weekly housekeeping $150 per visit required T

host_about:
Caroline moved to the USA in the 90's and  started First Class Properties LA and Life's a beach to assist her many UK-based entertainment industry friends looking for short-term and long-term accommodations in Los Angeles. In the passes 10 years since, Caroline has acquired a collection of beautiful rental properties and now caters to a large number of select clients from around the globe.

Caroline hand-picks every property with the primary criteria being stellar views, safe and sought-after locations, walkability, and a general “wow” factor. Many of the properties have fantastic amenities, including pools, spas and gyms, and all of the properties have easy onsite parking. As a professional interior designer, Caroline prefers minimalistic and easy living, a design aesthetic that is immediately identifiable when you set foot into any of her residences.

description:
Truly California living at it's best! 15 minutes away from the ocean; 5 min to shopping, markets and restaurants. This centrally located beautifully designed home sits on a quiet cul-de-sac in a L.A. suburb between Malibu, Santa Monica and the San Fernando Valley, 1 block to Topanga State Park in the Santa Monica Mountains and hiking trails. Have unforgettable moments that are distinctly yours with all the comforts of home or experience life in an exclusive location that protects your privacy.

The space
Get away from it all at this serene estate. Your new home is situated in a quiet, gated and guarded community tucked away within the Santa Monica Mountains. Your clean accommodations are perfectly situated between Malibu, Santa Monica, and the San Fernando Valley, putting you just 15 minutes from world-class beaches and only one block away from outdoor exploration at Topanga State Park. Of course, if you ever need anything, you’re only seven minutes up the hill fr
neighborhood_overview:
In gorgeous serene quiet Topanga Canyon set in the Santa Monica Mountains nestled between the ocean and San Fernando Valley is my beautiful estate home. We are close to the beaches, a grocery store, and plenty of activities and restaurants.

You will find hiking paths and bike trails only a few minute walk away. At night, you can see the stars while hearing the crickets chirp in the background after dark. The mountain breezes are incredible. The resort-style backyard has a BBQ, a walk-in pool, tables with seating for 12 provides. It is perfect for hanging out, studying, or escaping city life.
host_about:
Don't forget to smile :)

I'm a fun, energetic individual who loves making people smile and laugh. I am often the one who tries to brighten up the room as often as possible!

name_left: Spacious family home on 3 acres in Topanga Canyon
description:
Large family home on a serene private road surrounded by countless hiking trails and state park land with room for everyone to spread out. Our home sits on three acres of fenced land, with vegetable gardens and three outdoor patios to enjoy the views and tranquility of this magical canyon. The outside dining area makes summer night dinners especially memorable. Listen to the owls, read a book, bike or hike the trails, and enjoy the private and peaceful atmosphere on this special property.

Other things to note
Please note that the house can accommodate up to 10 people but we charge an additional $50 per person per night for any guests beyond 6.
neighborhood_overview: Topanga Canyon is truly a gem in Los Angeles - tucked away from the hustle & bustle in the Santa Monica Mountains right between the sandy beaches of Malibu and the San Fernando Valley. Surrounded by nature while still within reach of anything you could dream up. What feels like a total country experience actually puts you just 10 minutes from Whole Foods or Trader Joes to the East and 15 minutes to the Pacific Ocean to the West.
host_about: I'm Alex and my partner is Laura. I'm from Northern California and Laura is from Germany, and we live in lovely Topanga Canyon with our kids. I work as a photographer and Laura runs her own business, Muddle & Wilde. We love to travel as much as we enjoy hosting travelers here in our home.

name_left: Romantic cottage w outdoor soaking tub on trails
description:
The Meadow House is a tranquil sun filled cottage with gorgeous views into the Glenview Meadow and state park trails. A private outdoor soaking tub is located steps from your bedroom and gourmet meals can be catered for romantic dinners on your private deck and picnic lunches for hiking and beach (vegetarian and vegan available). Massages are also available on premises. The cottage is rustic yet comfortable and the sunsets are amazing. The main hiking trail is at your back door. Parking fr 1 car

The space
The Meadow house features trail access to Edelman’s State park which leads to Summit to Summit. The cottage is best suited for people who prefer a bohemian, outdoorsy vibe. The Dream Suite is a glorious space in which to relax, rejuvenate, and refresh. Nestled in Old Canyon, with the back drop of the Santa Monica Mountains, this is the perfect place to take a deep breath and realign with nature. Birdsong is the ambient music you'll hear as you soak in the luxurious copper bathtub, read a book in the comfy loft, or recline in the all-natural, king size bed with organic latex mattress. Pamper yourself in this restorative retreat. Truly a blissful getaway.

The space
We provide an all natural environment, both indoors and out. Our bedding and linens are cotton, and our comforters are natural feather-fill. Our King-sized bed is made from untreated wood, with an organic, 100% natural latex mattress on top. Our rugs are woven cotton. Even the building materials we use are selected from eco-friendly manufacturers. In addition, we use unscented cleaning products made by companies committed to sustainable materials and practices. W
neighborhood_overview: Topanga Canyon is a truly stunning place to visit, with hiking trails, the beach, and Topanga Town Center, all just a few minutes drive away.

name_left: Topanga Pool House
description:
The Topanga Pool House is located right at the edge of the State Park, providing unobstructed Canyon views and a lush, temperate climate filled with ocean breezes. The infrared sauna, cedar plunge pool, hot tub and outdoor bed on the palm shaded yoga deck provide a perfect environment to leave the hustle of the city and escape to where the mountains meet the sea.

The space
Welcome to the Pool house! The space itself itself is truly an oasis, thoughtfully appointed with luxury towels and linens as well as fine art books, vintage furniture and antique rugs. We've provided everything you'll need for a comfortable stay; from extra blankets to beach towels and local trail maps.

Guest access
Guests will have access to the pool, pool deck, sauna, hot tub and lower deck. These spaces are shared with us, the owners (we occupy the top unit) but we'll be respectful of your privacy and do our best not to overlap!

Other things to note</
neighborhood_overview: Our house is located in "Climate Perfect Fernwood" where the ocean air keeps us at least 10 degrees cooler in the summer and warmer in the winter than the rest of LA. name_left: Topanga Mtn Gate House
description:
Relax in total comfort in our Detached Topanga Gate House Studio. Kick back and enjoy the abundant nature that surrounds us. Located between the Pacific Ocean and the Valley you are minutes away from every modern convenience LA has to offer.

The space
Called the GATE HOUSE, this is a small studio space perfect for 1 or 2 people on a budget. Located on a beautiful property that is located in the middle of the Santa Monica Mountains. The Gate House is completely separate and free standing. It is not under a main house, you will not hear footsteps above you from the main house, which seems to be the way many rentals are set up in Topanga. The Gate house is a Studio, with a Kitchen and Bath Room, Laundry is located downstairs. It is located next to Topanga State Park with nearby access to trails that meander through 1000s of acres of undeveloped wilderness. The Santa Monica Mountains is the largest wilderness area within a city in all of the United States.. t
neighborhood_overview: Topanga is a fantastic place.  I grew up in New Mexico on a ranch with no electricity, no running water, and no telephone.   It was an environment where you truly grew to appreciate nature.  I live and work in Los Angeles, Topanga keeps me in contact with nature and my roots.
host_about:
I am a Lover of Art, Photography, Adventure, and Discovery.  I am a Director of Photography in the film and television industry who's credits include the Oscar Nominated "Invisible War", "Who Killed The Electric Car" and many others.

The only thing more important to me then these pursuits are my Family who allow me to rediscover all that is dear to me on a daily basis.   I am married to a wonderful woman, and have 2 beautiful and smart children.  I love to travel and experience.  Learning should always be a passion.

description:
Luxurious and simple, ShangriLaLa is tucked away amongst in the flowers and trees of a tranquil sanctuary garden, on one of the most private and quiet drives (with some of the best canyon views) in Topanga.
If ever you wished for a treehouse to live in (and don't want to sacrifice comfort) your wish is granted!
It is truly magical to bathe outdoors under the stars with a hot shower or soak in the hot oakwood bathtub.
You won't believe this mountain paradise is so close to bustling Los Angeles!

The space
This space is thoughtfully designed to provide a luxury outdoor//indoor experience.

Earth tones from the cedar wood walls & ceilings, as well as bamboo floors, make the indoor space feel welcoming and warm. Plush pillows and soft carpets add a cozy touch, while floor to ceiling windows invite the beauty of nature into the space, making it feel expansive.

The bedroom space is lofted and accessible by a beautifully handcrafte
neighborhood_overview:
Our drive is one of the closest to the ridge of the mountain we are situated on, making it more secluded and private (with some of the best views) in this part of the canyon.

Topanga is a relaxed, artisan community with one of the best vintage shops in LA (Hidden Treasures). Topanga is also home to several organic restaurants, a small country market, a couple cafes//coffeeshops, an outdoor performance amphitheater and some of the best hiking tails in LA!
host_about: Happy to host you for a memorable rejuvenating stay at our lovely tiny house! Topanga is a special community I'm blessed to now call home after relocating here from Boulder, Colorado to live closer to my daughter & grandson. I spent my career in the natural products world and believe in healthy living - mind, body, spirit.

name_left: Topanga Canyon Bungalow Oasis
description:
Nestled amongst the trees with canyon views and a cool ocean breeze, our magical home is exactly what you need to unwind, immerse yourself in nature, and find your inner peace.

Located at the bottom of the Fernwood area of Topanga Canyon, this little oasis will seem like a world away from the hustle and bustle of LA, yet is only 15 minutes from Santa Monica, 10 minutes from the beach, and a 5 minute walk to the nearest mountain trail.

Experience enchanted Topanga Canyon in a low key bungalow

The space
Inside this cozy and simple bungalow you will notice an eclectic yet bohemian jungle design aesthetic and a generous amount of natural light. The bedroom features a gorgeous Bali-style queen bed and an open closet. The room has a glass door that gives it access to a washing machine behind the unit, free for use and convenient for laundry on a long stay. The home also has a small sleeping loft with queen mattress above the living room. The tile
neighborhood_overview:
Located in the Fernwood area of the Canyon, Montau Drive is one of the most grounded neighborhoods that maintains cooler temperatures due to its proximity to the ocean and the sheer volume of plants and trees that shade it, all while still showing off sweeping canyon views.

We will leave personal instructions for some trails that are walkable from the house (one of the reasons we fell in love with the property). Other favorite hikes you can drive to include Tuna Canyon Park, Red Rock Park, and Topanga Canyon Park.

The bungalow is a 4 minute drive to our local Mimosa Cafe. We also like Topanga Living Cafe and Topanga Table. Restaurants nearby also include Tallula's, the Canyon Bistro, the Inn at the Seventh Ray in Topanga, and the Reel Inn, Cholada's , Malibu Farm Pier Cafe, Nobu's, and Gjelina on the PCH. There's even wine tasting at the Rosenthal Winery. All of these are within a 5 to 10 minute drive.

Culturally in Topanga there's Corazon for live mus
host_about:
Hello! 

My husband Ryan and I live in beautiful Topanga Canyon in Los Angeles county with our little baby girl and our big Siberian husky.

In addition to running my wellness practice, Spirit Forward Healing, I host our 2 lovely Airbnbs - our Bungalow and our Tiny Home - on the properties next door to our home and bordering the State Park. With direct access to hiking trails and a 7-minute drive to the beach, this magical and funky canyon is our little slice of heaven above the hustle and bustle of LA. 

Our family loves to travel around the US and the world and we often use Airbnb when we do. If you’re planning a trip to LA area or even a staycation out of the city, I hope you come stay with us at our oasis in Topanga!

Hi my name is Tara, married mother of one. 
I enjoy spending time with my family,  friends and dogs, taking in what beautiful Southern California has to offer in both the beach and mountains surrounding us daily.  I teach yoga both privately and in studio throughout Los Angeles. 
 
We are opening up our private extended space to visitors from all over and are very much looking forward to providing a place  that can be enjoyed.

Having done extensive traveling around the world, we know how any single place or experiences can leave a blissful imprint in your memory forever, and we’re happy to be apart of the memories. While hoping to create new lasting ones for ourselves.

name_left: Hidden Treasure in Topanga
description:
Our charming home is 15 minutes from the ocean and the valley, 20 minutes from Malibu, Santa Monica, 5 minutes from the famous Inn of the 7th Ray. Up a windy, tree-lined road, up a set of stairs, is an enchanted home, surrounded by oaks. Enjoy your hot cup of coffee in a cozy chair on the porch overlooking the canyon, or at night relax with a glass of wine, while breathing in mint from the local pine trees, blended with salty ocean air from the coast below to rejuvenate your soul.

The space
Ours has the charm and solidity of homes built in the 1930’s, with nooks and crannies, and a built-in sunny breakfast nook with fairy lights.
If you enjoy hiking, you need drive nowhere. Our home is on the state park road, where you can hike for miles amid the trees, caves and “red rocks.”
The first thing people say when they arrive, besides being a little breathless from the 48 steps leading up to the house, is “Wowow, ooooh, ahhhh.”
If you’re looking for a h
neighborhood_overview:
The serenity of Goddess Fairyland is the perfect space for creative people who need a break from the world--all you have to do is walk to the bottom of the property and you’re on the hiking trail, which is lush and gorgeous. Our neighbors are the best—everyone prizes their quiet, but the community is there at the drop of a hat if and when you need them. The buzz of civilization is close but far enough away for us to feel mother nature’s hum.

Old-fashioned charm, modern amenities, lots of windows, lots of sunlight, cool at night—and cool enough during the day (if you close the windows in the summer once the sun starts warming), house is on a magical hiking trail, quiet, lots of outdoor spaces, upper deck for a great canyon view, near the (famous) Inn of the 7th Ray restaurant, 15 minutes from ocean (surfing, boogie boarding, wind-surfing, wine tasting), 15 minutes from the valley (great restaurants, shopping, --40 minutes from Universal Studios, Harry Potter Ride), 30 minutes
host_about:
I’m on a mission to awaken the world to the power of dreams! I'm a dream enthusiast of both the sleeping and waking types of dreams. In fact, people call me “Doctor Dream.” I’m the bestselling author of seven books including I Had The Strangest Dream, It’s All In Your Dreams, Dreaming Heaven, Dream Oracle Cards, Discover Your Inner Goddess Queen, and Goddess Queen Pearls of Wisdom Journal. 

I began my fascination with dreams at age five with "tandem dream experiences" with my younger sister (sharing similar dreams and dreamscapes). Then in my 20s I pursued my then dream career as an actress and, in addition to working with Clint Eastwood, Forest Whittaker, Nicholas Cage, and Anthony Edwards, I was the lead in a B horror film entitled "Death By Dialogue" where my character realized if she change her dream (and life script) she could change her life. I didn’t realize then that this would become the premise of my future work (www.DreamLife (Website hidden by Airbnb) 

As a “dream expert” I've had the blessing of revisiting Hollywood, but this time, playing the role of myself, being featured on Doctor Oz, Ricki Lake, The Real, Bethenny, Huffington Post Live, Coast to Coast, and FOX news. 

I also believe that no dream-life is complete without giving back. I’ve been working with inner city kids for nearly a decade, and I find incredible bliss inspiring them to discover a vision of their future and the world that inspires them, take action on it, then pay it forward. My work with the Dream Project ( (Website hidden by Airbnb) and now the World Peace Caravan Youth Ambassador Program (Website hidden by Airbnb) along with my dreamwork contributes to me living my dream life. I look forward to helping you break free of the chains that bind, rewrite your script, and live the dream-life that you were born to live.

name_left: Peaceful Mountainside Retreat - Stunning Views
description:
Welcome to our hillside Haven! We invite you to share in the deep peace and inspiration found here, immersed in the sights and sounds of Nature. While we are only 20mins drive from Santa Monica, it feels like a world away.

The house is nestled in a wildlife corridor, in Upper Fernwood, with a knockout view across the Santa Monica Mountains.

This listing is for the entire garden level of our 3 story home. Every room opens onto the outside walkway patio with expansive views.

The space
We are about 5-10mins drive off Topanga Canyon Boulevard, up a winding, mountain road.

Expect to be awe inspired with how expansive and peaceful it is here! The skyline and landscape are ever changing, from being above the clouds, watching clouds form and the ocean mist sip up the canyon from PCH. Frog song and crickets make for a nightly sound-bath under a starlit sky. We often have deer and other wildlife roaming the property.

We have mad
neighborhood_overview:
We are nestled in a rare wildlife corridor, on the backside of Tuna Canyon.

Our expansive views stretch out over Topanga Canyon, from far across the valley and the Angeles National Park, to Eagle Rock, to a glimpse of DTLA beyond the ridge line.

You are 10mins drive from the amazing Topanga Living cafe or Cafe 27, both with excellent Coffee and Organic cafe food options for breakfast or lunch.

Inn of the Seventh Ray is a delightful, romantic option for an al fresco dinner.

The Canyon Gourmet has a fabulous deli style food and wine selection.

Topanga State Beach is 15mins by car and the stretch of Malibu beaches are 15-30 mins drive away.

name_left: The Flying Pig Treehouse Oasis
description:
The Unique Treehouse Oasis is nestled in an old oak tree overlooking a seasonal waterfall. The Treehouse is build in the tree but also resting on the ground so you have easy access from the ground over a little bridge. It sits on top of the seasonal waterfall cliff. It is a rustic bohemian tiny house with an outdoor bathroom, a deck and an outside BBQ area giving you a unique out of this world experience while still being in Los Angeles.
It invites you to unplug and get inspired by nature.

The space
Unplug , relax and get inspired by nature !!
The Flying Pig Treehouse retreat got its name because our daughter had the dream of having a Treehouse. We live in a desert climate here in the Los Angeles Area and it is very hard to find a strong enough tree. We found this spot which used to be a non-accessible 'jungle' on our property and found a tree which was growing on top of a seasonal waterfall....so it became the Waterfall Treehouse because we started
neighborhood_overview:
TOPANGA - the place of the people - is an amazing place to be in this world. This place was muse to many famous artists and musician and writers ( some still living here ). Elysium fields and Rodeo grounds were in a less than a 3 mile radius from here.

Little Bohemian town , nestled in the Santa Monica Mountains.
Great Vacation Spot, romantic retreat,special occasion, honeymoon, the place to propose, Weekend getaway or inspiring writers & artist Studio ( long term rates available).
A place to unplug and to recharge.

Enjoy all that beautiful Topanga Canyon has to offer while resting in Bungalow One, one of three suites on our property. This magical respite is all you need to take time away from the hustle and bustle of the everyday grind.

Wake up with the sun, listen to the birds chirp while nestled into this cozy coastal cabin suite.

@thetopangabungalows

name_left: Amazing View Near the Beach.  Peaceful Charm
description:
This charming bungalow home was built in the 1930's and is bursting with charm and natural beauty. We are situated only 9 minutes from the beach and the PCH. We are located in a coveted spot in the canyon because of the perfect climate, gentle sea breeze, and peace and quiet. The view is spectacular! Enjoy every meal in the most beautiful setting. Topanga canyon is famous for its artistic and outdoor influence. Endless mountain trails and Topanga state park are located only 5 min away!

The space
There is a bedroom with a queen bed and private lockable door upstairs and an open bedroom downstairs. There is one full bathroom upstairs and one full bathroom downstairs. The bedroom downstairs has a queen bed in the open area and then bunk beds and a single bed in an open kid only area. The bunk beds and single bed are only suitable for children as it is a small area with low ceilings.

The home is not safe for children under the age of 5 as they c
neighborhood_overview: Topanga is known for the many artists, scientists, musicians and diversity.  Topanga is a place to escape the city to rest in the mountains and recharge. Right down our street is the Mimosa cafe which is owned by a french woman.  The food is amazing and the atmosphere is so special.  Every Friday night between us and the beach, there is an organic outside taco stand.  The state park is 5 minutes away with endless hikes and mountain biking trails.  Our favorite beach, Topanga beach,  is at the bottom of the canyon (8 min away).  It has surfing, boogie boarding and rock searching.  The fishing is great too because of the coral reef.
host_about: We are a family of 5.  Chelsea, Adam, Lulu 10 years old, River 8 years old, and Ira 8 years old.  We live in Topanga, California but travel almost non-stop.

name_left: Topanga "Treehouse"
description:
This Topanga Tree House is on a private trail conveniently located off main road, 1/4 mile from Downtown. This is a 2 bedroom, plus large 300 sq foot sunroom. Two full baths, one with a beautiful clawfoot tub.

Master bedroom has amazing light with three skylights. Property includes washer/dryer, dishwasher, and fireplace. Two decks with morning sun in the treeline feels like you are in a treehouse of the 100+ year old Oak tree that is just in front of the house.

The space
Close proximity to downtown Topanga restaurants and shops and easy access to the state park and lots of other different trails. 100 yards from the backbone trail!
neighborhood_overview:
Our home is located just east of town (about a 2-minute drive). Town has two restaurants (Canyon Bistro & The Inn of the Seventh Ray). La Chingona Tacos (@lachingonatacos) sets up down at Jalan Jalan on Tuesdays, she is a Topanga staple! I would definitely recommend stopping by and trying some of her amazing tacos! There is also a general store if you need anything (Topanga Creek General Store) and Canyon Gourmet is a gourmet grocery store. They sometimes stock Gjusta bread which is in my opinion the best bread ever!

Town also has some shopping, our favorite being Hidden Treasures, the most amazing vintage store ever and has been a part of Topanga since the 70s! If you go east of town you will hit TLC which has the best coffee and smoothies. Further up Topanga is Woodland hills with numerous grocery stores and outdoor malls. Topanga Beach is just an 8-minute drive down Topanga Canyon Boulevard.

Topanga State park is also about a two-minute walk from our house. Yo
host_about:
Originally from South Africa,  I moved to Santa Monica for the sun and surf.

I can let you know about all the hidden gems of Santa Monica or just provide a great place to stay. 

Always preferring to stay in rental homes than hotels when traveling, I've really enjoyed sharing my beach abode with travelers.

name_left: Oaktree Studio & Micro Farm-Sanitized & SuperClean
description:
Welcome.
Oak Tree is a modern space with new wood floors, a comfortable, King size bed, kitchen, clawfoot bathtub/shower and environmental lighting on 1/2 acre of land.

Meticulously clean and sanitized per CDC standards. Self Check-in.

A private yard with BBQ and chaise lounges.

Shady, off-street, secure parking.

Our great aspiration is to be as environmentally responsible as possible. We collect rain water, direct gray water to the trees, and compost. :)

The space
The Brentwood King size mattress is incredibly comfortable and made with cotton and wool. We have 1000 thread count Egyptian cotton linens.
Our pillows and duvet are down-filled.
(If you need synthetic pillows or duvet we will gladly change them out for you)

Environmental, On-Demand hot water heater

Kitchen with a professional cooktop, toaster oven, French press, blender, microwave, fridge, French press and tea ket
neighborhood_overview:
We are 6 miles from the beach.
We are 2 miles to the center of Topanga with cafes, restaurants, art galleries, library, 2 general stores and natural food market.
We are 2 miles from Inn Of The Seventh Ray wedding venue and restaurant.

We are on a very quiet street with absolutely no traffic noise. Maybe 5 or 6 cars go by on a given day.

Walk out our front door and you can walk up our street to the dirt roads which lead you to hiking trails, enjoying the views and visiting horses along the way. Our street is a 2 mile loop with incredible views so you can have a great morning run.

Some places to visit are:
Inn of the Seventh Ray Restaurant and wedding venue (2 miles away) creek side dining under the oak trees and fairy lights. Very romantic.

Canyon Bistro Restaurant with outdoor patio (excellent grass fed burgers and sweet potato fries) Vegetarian options. Live music. Call to check their music schedule

Café Mimosa Fre
host_about:
My husband, Javier, and I love to travel. Javier is from Madrid and I am a LA native.
 I have lived in Nepal and Thailand, each for a month, London for a year and Japan for almost 4 years working for the Japanese government as an English teacher.  Between us we speak English, French, Spanish and some Japanese. 

I have a BFA in fine art and I started my own business with the money I saved in Japan doing decorative painting in high-end homes: gold leaf, sky ceilings, limewash finishes, frescoes, egg tempera and other decorative finishes. I love to paint, design and draw.

Javier and I are also crazy about Japanese design and we are inspired by the culture, architecture and food. 
Maybe you will feel a Japanese sensibility when you visit?

name_left: Bright, open, family home in the heart of Topanga
description:
Wonderful, spacious, bright, modern family home in the heart of Topanga. 2 minutes walk from amazing trails into the heart of the Santa Monica Mountains. Ten minutes from the beach, ten minutes to Woodland Hills. This home has 3 large bedrooms and a queen Murphy bed in the garage. The house has decks galore and there is also a kid’s tree-house and kids sleepover house (or peaceful meditation area) away from the main house (but with full wifi access!). It’s a perfect family getaway!

The space
Layout and amenities: The kitchen and large living room are on the first floor, along with the master bedroom. The master bathroom has recently been renovated and has double sinks and a giant bathtub with excellent water pressure! Naturally, the shower is amazing. The master bedroom also has a huge walk in closet. Downstairs there are two large children’s bedrooms and a bathroom with full bath and shower. One room has a giant sleeping loft! And of course a fire pole to get do
neighborhood_overview: Topanga sits quietly in the heart of the Santa Monica Mountains and has a very mellow, peaceful, nature loving vibe. This house sits minutes walk from awesome trails that take you right into the heart of the Topangan wilderness. Very few neighbors with unobstructed views of the canyon. Walking distance to the local cafe (Topanga Living Cafe) and restaurant (Cafe on 27).

name_left: Santa Monica mountains vintage trailer retreat

Escape to the heart of Socal's most famous bohemian artist community, Topanga Canyon. With comfy beds and an adorable kitchenet, this cozy completely restored 1965 Alladin trailer has you feeling totally at home under the pines and oaks in this large landscaped yard. Have a glass of wine or a cup of coffee on your own private deck with a view of the mountains and the vibrato of the frogs singing from the nearby creek. A short walk to town or hiking trails, this is the primo glamping experience!

The space
The trailer is located in the yard of a private home occupied by our family which includes two parents and two boys 13&11. The main house is in very close proximity to the trailer, however your privacy is a big priority to us! You may also be greeted by one of our two very friendly dogs or see one of us as we are coming or going but you will have your own private deck away from the house. It is a large multilevel property that may not be fit for young children or
neighborhood_overview: Topanga is the largest wildland park located within the boundaries of a major city. The world famous, 67 mile “Backbone Trail” runs right by our property making this a primo stopover! There are so many amazing hiking and mountain biking trails here and they are all outlined in our information packet when you arrive. Many are even walking distance! The local vibe here in Topanga is earthy and chill.  Our neighbors are surfers, outdoorsman and entertainment industry professionals seeking the escape Topanga has to offer.

name_left: Topanga Fernwood adorable guesthouse
description:
This guesthouse is set on a spacious property, in the desirable and peaceful Fernwood area of Topanga, known as "climate perfect Fernwood". It is a studio with a separate upstairs sleeping loft, please note the stair ladder up to the loft might not be suitable/safe for elderly or children. Basic bathroom. There is a fridge and freezer, and a hot plate, but no kitchen sink or other kitchen amenities. The land and driveway is shared with the main house, where I live with my toddler and dog.

Guest access
There is an electric gate to pull in to the driveway. I will look out for you on arrival, to open the gate and let you pull in. I will give you a gate clicker for your stay
neighborhood_overview: We are situated in a prime central location in Topanga and a five minute walk to a cute cafe and a few stores. The beach and PCH are a five minute drive away. Many wonderful hiking trails and the state park are close by. There are a handful of good restaurants in the Topanga village, such as The Inn of the Seventh Ray, Endless Color, Cafe on 27, Topanga Living Cafe, and Topanga Bistro.
host_about:
I am English, German, Uruguayan. I live in LA since 2009. I love Topanga for its peacefulness, nature, hiking trails, mountains, being close to the beach, feeling "removed" from LA, yet having it close by when needed.
I'm an avid traveller and happy to have found airbnb and be able to open my house to fellow travellers.

name_left: Topanga Homestead Cottage
description:
Set on a working Homestead, this charming
cottage with lovely view of mountains and horses. Made beautiful by a Topanga Craftsman and local artists, there is a feeling of old world artistry with all ammenities. The house rests on one of the first and original homesteaded properties in Topanga dating back to the 1800s. Private entrance and parking along with full kitchen and bathroom with all one could need for a relaxing stay. Come rest, take a breath .... a charming homestead stay

The space
We live on a Homestead with horses and chickens and all the wildlife that comes to visit. If you like fresh eggs, we have them.
The guesthouse is a perfect place to relax. As you drive up the driveway you can feel the rich history. This was one of the first homesteads here in Topanga. You enter the charming homestead cottage from your own front porch. There is a comfy queen bed, a bohemian chaise, a little desk. The kitchen with a cosy seating area has everything
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is quiet and lush with wildlife and beauty.
The beach is very close (about 15 minutes to PCH) as is the city if you want it. There are cafes in Topanga that are open for breakfast, lunch and dinner and the village has sweet shops for browsing and discovering eclectic gifts and clothes.

name_left: Tranquil & Secluded Retreat overlooking Topanga
description:
Quiet 2BR/1BA retreat at the heart of Topanga Canyon, huge deck w/ outdoor seating and a gorgeous view of the Topanga mountains.

The space
This secluded house, is perfect to relax at, enjoy the view and take in all the oxygen. Not suitable for ANY type of gatherings or events. We are located in a very peaceful neighborhood, residents of which take the tranquility of the surroundings very seriously.
The host resides in the attached guest house but commutes through a separate entrance. Guests will be given full privacy within the premises of the advertised unit.

Guest access
Guests will be provided with ONE designated parking spot in the driveway. Once parked, they can enter the premises through the side access at the end of the driveway and use the deck to get to the main entry door. Use the 4-digit passcode that you'll be provided a few days prior to your check-in date, to gain access inside the unit.
neighborhood_overview: Topanga is famous for its tranquility,  and the residents thrive to respect the peace of the community. Thus we enforce very strict rules on over occupation and excessive noise. This unit is meant for people who seek a relaxing experience in the great nature of Topanga Canyon.
host_about: An architect living in Los Angeles hosting a few properties as well as having a unique passion to travel and explore!

name_left: Love Stream 2 Romantic Nature Getaway in Topanga
description:
Vintage Airstream on bluff with deck over looking woods and seasonal creek located at animal sanctuary. Come stay in our renovated 1960 Ambassador Airstream in Topanga, CA surrounded by llamas, sheep, pigs and giant African tortoises. Relax next to a seasonal creek and 100 year old oak trees in Jacuzzi, steam sauna in the evening & sip wine at fire pit. Hike to nearby ocean views and waterfall at state park. Minutes to beach. The perfect Staycation and romantic couples getaway!!!

The space
Animal sanctuary with tours available.

Other things to note
Animal sanctuary and rescue. Bluff over looking seasonal creek. Jacuzzi and sauna on bluff. Certified yoga teacher, certified exercise physiology instructor, certified vegan chef, private animal experience tour and massage services also available. Another Airstream is located on property with intermediate guest. Both are available for short term rentals.
neighborhood_overview: Private road with nearby homes spread out in woods.
host_about: I am an interior designer by trade and my wife is an exercise physiologist , nutritionist and plant-based chef.  Hospitality is our number one goal. We are long time vegans and animal advocates. We find ourselves incredibly lucky to live in the canyon and Santa Monica mountain range of Topanga. Hikes, nature, water falls, beach and romantic dining are minutes from our retreat. This is the perfect location for our animal rescue ranch foundation.

Unwind under the stars in your private cedar hot tub, and rinse off in the outdoor shower before tucking in to bed. We live in a quiet neighborhood and hope you enjoy the visit under the trees getting your deep R&R ,for sure. :)

The space
This beautifully appointed canyon home is located within minutes from Topanga State Beach, endless miles of hiking trails and the quaint town of Topanga which offers organic grocers, excellent restaurants, and local craft shops. The house itself is flooded with light and mountain views from every window. The back yard is like your very own spa oasis with a large hot tub, redwood deck and tranquil outdoor shower. Bordered by state wild lands, this unique property at the end of a cul-de-sac road is a private retreat in nature, with a
neighborhood_overview: The is located just South of the town of Topanga and just above the spectacular S- curves the lead you to the Pacific Coast Highway. The stores, large grocery stores, restaurants and cafes of Woodland Hills and The Pacific Palisades are a mere 15 minutes away.
